In her job as a primary school teacher, Jeyny is dedicated to her role of sharing knowledge with her students. Currently she is deputy director of the school where she teaches. She is a single mother with two children. 

Jeyny has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to make improvements to her house, a dream she has long wished to be fulfilled. She will use the money to buy construction materials such as a laundry sink, decorative blocks, sand, paint, electric power points, cement, simple switches, 40 watt bulb, cable, doors, and labour. In this way her family’s standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Matilde Del Socorro

texts.es:
Matilde es una señora con visión de futuro en cuanto al mejoramiento de los niveles de vida, es casada no tiene hijo a su cargo, es maestra de educación primaria con 23 años de laborar, quiere ampliar su vivienda lo que le hizo tomar la decisión de visitar ceprodel para solicitar crédito el que utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, arena, piedrín, hierro y mano de obra.
El que le permitiría realizar la obra que desea como es la construcción de un cuarto y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Matilde has a vision of the future in which her standard of living is much improved. She is married but doesn’t have any children to raise. She has been a primary school teacher for 23 years.

Now Matilde wishes to enlarge her house. She decided to approach Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, sand, gravel, reinforcing iron, and labour. These supplies will enable her to add an extra room and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy construction supplies to build an extra room on her house

loans.name: Milka's Group

texts.en:
Milka is a member of Buruburu Group in Matete District.  She is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 97 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Milka has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	

Milka is married and has 2 children.  She is 35 years old and is known for being hardworking and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Milka has been a farmer for 7 years.  Milka described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Milka first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2006 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Milka joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers.  Milka plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Milka’s own life was improved because she was able to feed the family.

Milka and the Buruburu Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. This enabled him to buy more products for his mini-grocery store which he has been running for the past five years. He was able to help his parents and siblings with the income from the business. He continues to work to provide for his needs as well as his family's needs.
 
He would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan, which he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. This will definitely help him to meet their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Melecio hopes that his business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a better living. He meets up with the members of his fellowship* to share stories of his work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed for his business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 48 years old. He is a father of five children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua comprando y vendiendo condimentos, granos secos, papa, cereales entonces envía sus productos a las revendedoras de uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como por ejemplo cebada,  maíz y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Manuela is grateful to lenders for their continued support, and she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase dry grains, potatoes, cereals and other items to stock her business. She sells these and other products in the central market in Cusco, and she hopes to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry grains, such as barley, corn and other staples foods.

loans.name: Chantale Elisabeth

texts.fr: Chantale est une femme de 50 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 et 27 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate)  dans un marché de la place depuis 18 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomate ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chantale is a 50-year-old woman who is a married mother of eight children, from 6 to 27 years old. She is a merchant and has been selling fresh staple items (tomatoes) at a local market for eighteen years. She is very familiar with suppliers, especially her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly short of inventory because she is compelled to sell her entire inventory in order to procure more. This is due to her meager capital. 

Chantale would like to increase her stock of tomatoes in crates, enabling her to satisfy better her customers' constant demand and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Verónica María

texts.es:
Verónica es una señora con mucho deseo de superación en la vida personal de luchar por alcanzar el sueño deseado de tener su propia vivienda, es casada con 1 hijo a su cargo al que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, de profesión maestra de educación primaria del cual tiene 16 años de laborar.
Esta señora tiene la urgencia de completar la compra de un lote de terreno donde será en el futuro su casa de habitación propia. Por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el sueño deseado ya que el mismo lo utilizara en el Completamiento de pago de terreno y formalización de Escrituración, el que atravez del  apoyo del crédito lo hará posible y mejorar los niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Veronica is a woman with a great desire to succeed in her personal life and she works to achieve her dream of owning her own house.  She is married and has a son whom she cares for and she gives him all the support he needs for his development.  She is an elementary school teacher and has been doing this for 16 years.

This woman is married and she wants to buy a lot on which to build her house in the future.  She visited CEPRODEL to request a loan and will use the money to pay for land and a deed.   The loan will make this possible and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land a pay for a deed.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora entregada por completo al cuido y desarrollo de su familia, es viuda ya no tiene hijos a su cargo, ella labora como conserje en un centro de  salud donde vive con 26 años de servicios.
Esta señora presenta la necesidad de construir una cocina la que tiene en mal estado, por eso visito las oficinas de  ceprodel  para solicitar financiamiento para la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, zinc, perlin, arena, bloques y mano de obra.
Y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Francisca  is a woman completely dedicated to the caring and development of her family.  She is a widow, doesn’t have any children and has worked as a counselor at a health center for 26 years.  This lady needs to build a kitchen because hers in in poor state, so she visited the CEPRODEL office to request a loan to buy building materials, such as cement, zinc metal, metal bars, sand, cinder blocks, and pay for labor.  This way she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nelson José

texts.es: Nelson es un señor que por  generaciones a impartido clases a niños y adolescentes, ya que su profesión es maestro de educación primaria y secundaria con 29 años de servicio en diferentes colegios de la zona, este señor tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda, atravez de financiamiento lo que visito a ceprodel para tener la oportunidad de realizar la obra que tanto la necesita, ya que el mismo  lo utilizara en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, piedrín, arena, alambre de amarre y mano de obra, para Reconstruir los pilares y la pared y de esa manera darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is a man who has been teaching generations of children and teens.  He is a middle school teacher and has been doing this in different schools in the area for 29 years.  This man needs to make improvements to his house, so he visited CEPRODEL to request a loan that will allow him to do this work that he desperately needs.  He will use the money to buy iron bars, cement, pebbles, sand, bailing wire, and pay for labor to rebuild the pillars and a wall and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mtafutaji Group

texts.en:
This group of three men and one woman is a Nuru International group of farmers, based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture. The person with his hand raised in the picture is Alphaxard. He is 43 years old, married, with six children who go to school. Alphaxard has been a member of this group for the past three years and has benefited from learning about various ways of improving farming methods. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains season.

Alphaxard desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizer on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  He is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva, which will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. Alphaxard believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, which will not only provide enough food for his family, but also result in a surplus. He will sell the surplus and obtain money to contribute to his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Light Bank Group

texts.es: Mariela, quien en la fotografía aparece sentada en medio de dos hombres, pertenece al Banco Comunal Light Bank que queda en la comuna de Cañete, en donde sus socios tienen distintos negocios tales como chocolatería, venta de mariscos, ropa nueva, legumbres. La venta de empanadas, pasteles de choclo y humitas son el negocio de Mariela. Su negocio lo tiene hace casi 4 años, y lo comenzó a raíz de una grave enfermedad de su hijo mayor fue ayudada por un vecino quien le regalo un horno industrial para hacer empanadas y un poco de dinero. La empresa es familiar, y los desafíos que tiene es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar sus carreras.  El préstamo que solicitará es para poder comprar más insumos para sus empanadas carne, harina bolsas en donde entrega las empanadas, servilletas, y además para comprar choclos para el pastel y las humitas. Espera que le vaya muy bien ya que tiene su clientela. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que para solicitar el préstamo no es necesario hacer grandes trámites.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Community Bank Light Bank, which is located in the community of Cañete. In the photo, Mariela is seated in the front row between two of her male colleagues. The various members of the group make a living in a variety of trades, including chocolate making and sales, seafood sales, clothing sales, vegetable sales, etc. Mariela makes a living selling homemade food dishes, including empanadas, corn cakes and other items. She started her business four years ago when her older brother became very ill and she needed to earn money to help with his medical expenses and treatment. Her's is a family business, and Mariela works very hard to support her children in their education and studies.

With the support from this loan, Mariela plans to purchase input items for making her food dishes, including meat, flour, corn, bags for packaging, napkins, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business, since she already has an established client base. Mariela has really enjoyed being a member of the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the opportunities she has received.

loans.use: to purchase input items for making her empanadas, corn cakes and other food dishes.

loans.name: Angela Romero

texts.es: Ángela de 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas  las cuales ya son mayores de edad  y le colaboran con la economía  del hogar. Ángela es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable quien todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para realizar la venta de variedad de ropa nueva la cual es muy demandada por sus clientes. Ángela desea terminar de construir un cerco perimetral ya que desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tela metálica y así comenzar el cerco perimetral lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Angela is 53 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two adult children; they help with the household finances.  Angela is a hardworking, enterprising lady who travels along all of the main areas where she lives to sell a variety of new clothing, for which she has much customer demand.

Angela wants to build a perimeter fence because she wants to provide more security to her family.  She is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, in order to buy chain link fencing and begin building the fence as soon as possible.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
Dennis se dedica a la elaboración de productos derivados de la leche, como natilla, queso y también vende leche, sus clientes son locales y han acogido positivamente sus productos. Dennis  necesita renovar su ganado  para mantener la producción de leche, solicita ochocientos mil colones (¢800.000) dinero con el que comprará dos vacas para continuar 
con su actividad.
texts.en: Dennis makes dairy products such as custard, cheese, and also sells milk.  His customers are local and welcome his products.  Dennis needs to replenish his livestock in order to maintain his milk production.  He is asking for a loan of eight hundred-thousand Colones (¢800.000) so he can buy cows to continue his activities.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Edwige Scholastique

texts.fr: Edwige est une jeune femme mariée, mère d'un enfant. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future
texts.en:
Edwige is a young married woman with one child. After her training, she opened a hair salon, which she has run for two years now. She often has a problem with a shortage of cosmetics, hair extensions and hair weaves in her salon because she buys her products retail. Her goal is to satisfy her customers and to earn a good profit.

Edwige is requesting this loan to buy her supplies in large quantities, which will allow her to achieve her goals. The profit she earns with this loan will help meet her and her child’s needs, as well as to increase her savings so she can grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Daniel Alejandro

texts.es: Daniel de 21 años de edad habita junto a su madre y padre  en casa propia. Daniel es un joven trabajador que cada día se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su trabajo ubicado en una zona cercana a su localidad. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea apoyar a su familia en la mejora de la cubierta del techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra dañado. No cuenta con el capital disponible por lo que encontró la alternativa de solicitar este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera  y así poder dar inicio al cambio de techo lo antes posible. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
21-year old Daniel lives with his parents in their own house. He is a hardworking young man who gets up early every day to set out for work at a place near his home. The conditions in which he lives are very simple, and he wishes to help his family mend the roof of their house which has fallen into disrepair.

As he doesn’t have enough money of his own, Daniel has approached FUSAI to ask for a loan to buy galvanised sheets and wood so he can start the work as soon as possible. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheets and wood to repair the roof

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa has been running a general store for seven years, making a good earning for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to improve her offerings, and it was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Arjanik

texts.en:
Arjanik is an agronomist from Margahovit village of Lori region. He lives with his parents, wife and daughter. His son currently serves in the army. Arjanik runs a small but profitable farm. He owns cows, pigs and oxen. Arjanik also owns a small plot of land where he cultivates potatoes and other vegetables. Arjanik takes the gathered harvest to the nearby open market and sells to local re-sellers.

Arjanik works hard to give his family appropriate living conditions. He currently is asking for a loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase forage and feed the livestock. Taking into consideration the current financial difficulties that Arjanik faces, the loan will be a huge support for him. The farming business is very important for him and Arjanik hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
This is Rolanda. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rolanda dreams of having another tricycle unit, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
This is Ma. Fe, 30-years-old, and resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joe Mark, her business partner, and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Fe operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

Ma. Fe hopes to be successful in business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 37-years-old.  She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during maize production

loans.name: Kiomatate Group

texts.en:
Kiomatate is a Nuru International group of six farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Kiomatate collectively guarantee the loan.

Catherine, who is raising up her hand, is the leader of this group. She is 49-years-old and married with nine children. She has been a member of this group for three years now.  The loan from Kiva will enable her to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable her to realize a bounty harvest. Catherine, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. The harvest she gets will ensure food security for her household which is a big family, and she is also optimistic she will get a surplus. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for sixteen years now.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakule est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Mufariji », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui 5 étudient et 1 autre est encore gosse. La cliente est une vendeuse de farine de maïs. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 6 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Kakule, is a shopkeeper and a member of the "Mufariji" business group.

This dynamic entrepreneur is 38 years old and is the mother of six children. Five of her children go to school, but one is too young. 

The client sells corn flour. She sells her goods in front of her home where she knows how to find her clients.

She initially started her business with her husband's capital. Her spouse is a teacher in a local school. Later on, she received a loan from l’IMF Hekima. She has been running her business for eight years. She will use this new loan to buy six bags of cassava flour.  She would like to buy a house and to educate and feed her children. 

She strongly thanks Hekima for the empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy six bags of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hasil

texts.en:
Hasil is 49-years-old and lives in the Sabirabad region.  He is married and has three children.  For the past fifteen years, Hasil has been working hard to manage his clothing shop.

To help expand his  business, Hasil has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN from Aqroinvest CU. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Hasil to generate greater profits and take care of his family’s basic needs.  Hasil hopes that in the future he will be able to increase the stock in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza helped her husband earning a living by managing their own farm of corn while her husband does business in town. For five years in running this farm, Aiza made a good living, so she was able to provide for the needs of the family, especially her two children. 

She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to boost her farm. 

She is hopeful to gain more profit during this season, and use it for their needs. She wants to live better in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is 30 years old; he is married to a farmer. He has spent seven years in the business. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family; she is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has had this business for two years.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 53-years-old and has one child who is still in school.

Mary Ann has a sand and gravel business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Gosoho Group

texts.en:
This group of five people is part of Nuru International's group of farmers called Gosoho, and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is Paul. He is 61 years old, and married with 6 children. It is the second year for Paul as a member of this group.

Paul desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizer on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. 

Paul believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to contribute to his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: M. Shafique

texts.en:
M. Shafique, aged forty, is an energetic man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He has been doing this business for many years and getting a reasonable income for his family.  He is responsible for his children, siblings and old parents.  His father has grown old and does not do any job.  His uses all efforts to provide comfort to his parents and younger brothers.

He is a milkman by profession.  He sells milk and bull calf to the butcher.  He has few buffalo; he gets milk two times in a day. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door.  For delivery purposes, he uses his motorbike. He loads milk cans on his bike and delivers them early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs. He has to afford the expense for fodder and the whole household expenses alone. 

Therefore, M. Shafique requested from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy an additional buffalo to get more milk to sell. With the profit amount, he can easily buy the fodder for his herd.  M. Shafique wants to increase his herd by purchasing more cattle so that he could cherish his whole family in well manners.  M. Shafique thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Heqiqet

texts.en:
Heqiqet is 54 year old. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two daughters. Their two daughters are receiving an education. 

Heqiqet is engaged in agribusiness. She is a very energetic and hardworking woman. She grows vegetables on her inherited piece of land. She sells her harvest in the local market and earns money for a livelihood, but her income is too low to run a family of four members well. 

So Heqiqet has decided to start a new business selling milk and dairy products.

Heqiqet applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy a dairy cow. 

Her plan is to start a milk supply and dairy products (butter, curd, paneer, etc.) business. She wants to supply milk and dairy products door-to-door in her locality and in the local market. These products are in great demand in the present market.

Her full thanks go to Aqroinvest CU and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер глубоко духовный и верующий человек. Алишер растет пятерых детей. Двоих дочерей и троих сыновей. Старшей дочери 15 лет она помогает своим родителям присматривать за братьями и сестрой. Алишер кормит свою семью за счет продажи авто запчастей. Такая работа приносит ему не большой доход. Потребности клиентов возрастают, спрос на новые виды запчастей увеличиваются и Алишер просит кредит, чтобы купить новые запчасти. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. В надежде, что вы ему поможете!
texts.en: Alisher is a deeply spiritual and religious person. Alisher is raising five children: two daughters and three sons. The eldest daughter, who is 15 years old, helps her parents to watch over her brothers and sister. Alisher feeds his family by selling auto parts. This work brings him no large income. The needs of customers grow, demand for new types of parts increases, and Alisher is requesting a loan to buy new parts. With this aim, he applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 57 años de edad habita en condiciones muy  sencillas junto a su compañero de vida, mamá e hijos, en casa propia.  Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas como: pastelitos de carne, enchiladas, etc. El negocio lo tiene en su lugar de habitación y gracias a la calidad y buenos precios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más.  Isabel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila ya que la  que tiene se encuentra dañada y además, desea construir un baño. Con el crédito comprará cemento,ladrillo, arena, grava y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así comenzar la construcción de la pila y el baño lo antes posible que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Isabel is 57 years old and lives in her own, very simple house with her life partner, mother and children. Isabel works selling typical meals, such as meat pies and enchiladas, and more.  She runs the business out of her home and, thanks to the good quality and affordable price, she has managed to gain the trust of many customers who prefer to come to Isabel's stall every day.  Isabel is apply for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in building a basin in her home as the one she currently has is damaged.  She would also like build a bathroom.  Isabel will use this loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron.  Isabel hopes to be able to count on this loan and to start building the basin and bathroom she so desperately needs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron in order to construct a bathroom and basin.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continúa trabajando en una entidad del estado pero en sus horas libres continuas dedicándose  atender su bar y le va muy bien. 

Margot pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Margot is grateful to investors for her previous loan and is happy with the support provided.  She continues to work for a state entity but, in her spare time, she is still running her bar and this is going very well.

Margot has been part of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank for many years.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy beverages such as beer and fizzy drinks. Margot is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible with her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as beer and sodas.

loans.name: Marys

texts.en:
Marys helps her husband in running their business to make a living. She has been doing this for three years, earning enough to provide for the needs of the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell to boost her store. 

She is hopeful to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is 30 years old. He is married, and has spent five years in the business. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is married, with eight children.  He operates his rice farm to make a living. 

After five years on the farm, Samson earned well so that he was able to provide the needs of the entire family. Samson always finds ways to augment the living of his family. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. 

He is hopes to gain more returns, and save a portion of it for a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a poultry business, selling chicks and eggs at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chicken feed and chemicals to prevent diseases for her hens. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chemicals to prevent diseases for her hens.

loans.name: Nofel

texts.en:
Nofel is 45 years old and married. Even though he is young, he has four daughters. He takes care of the household and raises the children. He is a very diligent, responsible, kind, and careful by nature. 

Nofel raises livestock and plants crops to provide the main source of income for his family. He has 12 years of experience in this field.

Thanks to his hard work, Nofel now has four dairy cows and four hectares of land for planting potatoes and tomatoes every year. He has everything he needs to take care of the livestock. His monthly income is 120 AZN  from this business. 

In order to develop his farm, Nofel asked Aqroinvest CU and Kiva for a loan 1200 AZN to buy more cows. 

Nofel plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock, and to save money to improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es: Claudia de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre y dos hermanas. Ella trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y de esta forma ayuda a su familia con los gastos diarios. Es una joven muy trabajadora y responsable. Desea construir un baño para el cual es necesario pagar mano de obra  y comprar los materiales. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena, y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar inicio a la construcción del baño lo antes posible.
texts.en: Claudia is 22 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and two sisters.  Claudia works at an institution near her town and, with this work, she is able to help with living costs.  Claudia is a very hard-working and responsible young woman.  She wants to build a bathroom and so needs to pay for labourers and materials.  To do this work, Claudia is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, bricks, sand and galvanised laminate sheeting.  She hopes to be able to count on this support and then start building the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and galvanised laminate sheeting in order to build a bathroom.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Rosario” está constituida por 08 mujeres emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Ella es Rosa de 66 años de, separada con 05 hijos independientes. Lleva más de 06 años dedicándose a la venta de medias ambulatoria de medias, ropas interiores entre otros. Negocio que le ha permitido mejorar  su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la  compra de  medias, pantis y ropas interiores. Su mayor deseo es de instalar  un puesto donde pueda exhibir  sus productos y de esta manera dejar de ofrecerlos ambulatoriamente. El grupo “El Rosario” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rosa se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca roja.
texts.en: The "El Rosario" group has eight enterprising members who look to improve their lives every day.  One member of the group is 66-year-old Rosa.  She is separated, has five now independent children, and for six years she has been working selling socks, underwear and more as a street vendor.  This business has allowed Rosa to improve her home. On this occasion she is applying for a loan in order to buy socks, pants, and underwear. Her biggest dream is to have a stall where she can display her products and stop working as a street vendor.  The "El Rosario" group is grateful to those who are making this loan possible. In the photo, Rosa is second on the left, standing up, and wearing a dark red/pink top.

loans.use: to buy socks, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 35 years old. He is a father of three children between the ages of 5 and 12. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María comenzó a construir su casa pero no logró concluirla, necesita terminar el área de la cocina, patio trasero y concluir otros detalles que son importantes para que la familia habite cómodamente en la vivienda. Ella solicita quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) con este dinero comprará los materiales necesarios para realizar los trabajos y mejoras de su vivienda. María agradece la oportunidad de finaciamiento que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: María began to build her house but was not able to complete the work - she needs to finish the kitchen, back patio, and do other little jobs so that the family is comfortable in the house.  María is applying for 500,000 Colones in order to buy the necessary material to do the necessary work and make the improvements to her home.  María is grateful for this opportunity of a loan with which she is being provided.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Kenia Carolina

texts.es:
La Joven Kenia  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en  una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Kenia su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha y necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia  prima  como maíz, leña y cal, para  seguir elaborando sus tortillas y  de  esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Kenia espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia. 
Kenia espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre   2013
texts.en:
Kenia is a hard-working and responsible person that lives with her family in a community in the southern region of Honduras.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living.

Kenia's business is well-known in the community and there is a lot of demand for her products.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as corn, wood, and lime, in order to continue making her tortillas and thus continue making an income, which is very important to her household.

Kenia wants to send her thanks for this loan because she will be able to buy the ingredients she needs to continue running her business and to meet the demand of her customers.  She will be able to increase her sales and her success will be reflected in an improved quality of life for her family.

Kenia hopes that her business continues to grow and that she will become more popular in the community, which will help her continue supporting her family so that they have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor tiene 26 años, vive en concubinato y tienen dos hijos a los que mantiene y ayuda en su educación. Es agricultor y tiene plantaciones de cítricos y arroz, trabaja todos los días del año para que a su familia no les falte nada. Vive en una casa que se compró hace varios años en la población de Ivirgarzama, pero la misma tiene algunos desperfectos como goteras, muros rotos, etc. por ello solicita un crédito para refaccionar su vivienda, y así brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Victor is 26 years old and lives with his wife and their two children who he supports and helps pay for their education.  He works in agriculture and grows citrus fruits and rice.  He works every day of the year so that his family has what they need. 

He lives in a house in Ivirgarzama that he bought many years ago.  The house has many problems such as leaks, broken walls, etc.  He is seeking a loan so that he can repair the house in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Balthazar

texts.en:
Balthazar is 46 years old; he is married, with 6 children. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Yasmara Lucia

texts.es:
Yasmara es una joven señora de profesión maestra de educación primaria madre soltera con un hijo al que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la urgencia de construir una cocina por lo que visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar las obras para lograr lo deseado, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Bloques, Perlin, Cemento, Hierro, Arena y Mano de Obra.
Y de esa manera darle las condiciones  a su familia para una mejor vida
texts.en:
Yasmara is a teacher in a primary school.  She is a single mother with a son and she provides everything he needs.  

She currently has an urgent need to build a kitchen and she came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. She needs financing to complete the work.  She will use it to buy construction materials such as zinc, bricks, perlins, cement, iron, sand, and to pay for manual laborers.  By doing this, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, bricks, perlins, cement, sand, iron, and to pay manual laborers.

loans.name: Marta Blanca

texts.es: Marta de 43 años de edad habita en casa propia con su esposo y sus 4 hijos.  Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar y dan a sus hijos el sustento diario.  Marta posee una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su  hogar de residencia. Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia para sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el repello de las  paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar cemento y si es posible también comprará pintura. Espera poder contar con este  apoyo y así poder mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband a four children.  She and her husband maintain the household finances and provide their children with their daily sustenance.  Marta has a small store that she managed wit set up in her home with great effort.  Her home is her first priority and future inheritance for her children.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, in order to cover the walls in her home.  She needs to buy cement and paint if possible.  She hopes to get this support so she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María de  65  años de edad, vive con su esposo no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad al sur  de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace  04  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y frescos.
Doña María también vende ropa que le mandan los hijos de los Estados Unidos, es  una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejora de vivienda.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de bloques, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra,  con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su calidad de vida  y quiere aprovechar la época navideña para realizar estas mejoras ya que su cocina esta en malas condiciones, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma es un excelente cliente,  su sueño es terminar su cocina para este año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 65 years old and lives with her husband.  They have no dependent children.  María lives in a community in southern Honduras.  She has her own home and has been in the business of selling groceries and soft drinks for four years.  Doña María also sells clothing that is shipped to her from her children in the United States.  She is an enterprising woman who greatly wants to succeed on behalf of her family.  

María is requesting a new loan for home improvements.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor.  With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her quality of life.  She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season for making these improvements since her kitchen is in bad condition.  

This is the fourth loan she has requested from Prisma and she is an excellent client.  Her dream is to have her kitchen finished this year.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina continua dedicándose a la venta de comida y le va muy bien, ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, verduras, carne, fideos y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Guillermina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 42 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Guillermina continues to sell her food and all is going well.  She still belongs to the bank "Virgen del Rosario" and she needs a loan in order to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, noodles, and other things like these.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Guillermina was born in Paucartambo and she is 42 years old.  She is married with four children. She is a mother, a hard-worker, and an entrepreneur that works hard to help her family get by.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Nelis

texts.es:
Doña Nelis es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Nelis necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal,  para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y de esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Nelis espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
Doña Nelis espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Nelis is a hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in the southern region of Honduras.  She makes and sells tortillas.  Her business is well-known in the community and there is a lot of demand for her products.

Nelis is seeking a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as corn, wood, and lime, in order to continue making her tortillas and thus continue making an income, which is very important to her household.

Nelis says that thanks to this loan she will be able to buy the ingredients she needs to continue running her business and to meet the demand of her customers. She will be able to increase her sales and her success will be reflected in an improved quality of life for her family.

Nelis hopes that her business continues to grow and that she will become more popular in the community, which will help her continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Rocina

texts.es:
Rocina, a sus 42 años de edad, ha dedicado su vida productiva a trabajar en el campo de la belleza, inició trabajando como empleada en una peluquería, donde adquirió conocimientos y experiencia en el oficio y, desde hace 6 años decidió independizarse y montar su propia sala de belleza, allí ofrece el servicio de corte, cepillado, manicure y pedicure, adicionalmente vende productos de belleza a sus clientes con el fin de complementar los ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para seguir brindando educación universitaria a su hija.
Con el apoyo del crédito Rocina desea fortalecer su negocio, pues comprará insumos al por mayor (tinturas, cosméticos, accesorios, tratamientos capilares) y además renovará las sillas de peluquería y comprará una plancha para el cabello; esto le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con productos de calidad y satisfacer sus necesidades, abriendo paso a atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar las ventas y los ingresos.
La titular expresa que su mayor anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecer nuevas oportunidades de empleo, además aumentará la capacidad de atención, generando así una mayor rentabilidad para dar a  su familia una mejor calidad de vida y lograr pagar toda la carrera profesional de su hija, pues desea verla convertida en una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Rocina, 42 years old, has spent her productive life working in the beauty field. She started working as an employee in a hair salon where she acquired the requisite knowledge and experience. Six years ago she decided to become independent and opened her own beauty salon. There she provides services such as hair cutting, waxing, manicures and pedicures. She also sells beauty products to her customers with the goal of supplementing her income.  Thus she can help her husband with household expenses and also continue paying for their daughter’s university education.

With the loan’s help Rocina wants to strengthen her business. She will buy supplies wholesale (dyes, cosmetics, accessories and hair treatments) as well as replace the hairdressing chairs and buy a hair iron. This will enable her to offer better service to her customers by using high quality products and to satisfy their needs, thus attracting new clients and improving her sales and earnings.

This shop owner states that her greatest desire is to expand her business and offer new employment opportunities. As well she will increase her service capacity and generate more profit. This will allow her to give her family a better quality of life and pay for her daughter’s professional studies. She wants to see her become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (dyes, cosmetics, accessories, hair treatments),  replace her hair-dressing chairs and buy a hair iron.

loans.name: Dubán

texts.es:
Dubán, a sus 27 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y activo que siempre ha buscado la manera de ganarse la vida de una forma honrada. Hace 4 años comenzó a vender mercancía de manera independiente, ofreciendo jeans, camisas, chaquetas para adultos y niños; el oficio lo aprendió de una amiga que realizaba la misma labor y le enseñó todo el manejo de este tipo de negocio; sus principales clientes son familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector y así ha generado los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. 
Manifiesta que su principal sueño por el cual lucha día a día, es tener un local abierto al público, en el que ofrezca sus productos y además le permita generar empleo; pero para lograrlo Dubán es consciente que debe seguir trabajando con disciplina y dedicación; esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para capitalizar su actividad, pues con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas, chaquetas, pijamas, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos y podrá ofrecer más variedad para que sus clientes satisfagan sus gustos y necesidades; mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su mayor anhelo y tener la capacidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dubán, 27, is an enterprising and active man who has always looked for a way to make an honest living. Four years ago, he started selling merchandise independently by selling jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and jackets for adults and children. He learned this skill from a friend who does the same work and taught him how to manage this type of business. His main customers are family, neighbors, and friends in the area. This has allowed him to make enough income to support the household.

He says that his main goal, which he works for every day, is to have a shop open to the public so he can sell his products and generate jobs. However, to achieve this, Dubán knows that he has to keep working with discipline and dedication. This led him to request the help of a loan to capitalize his business. With the money, he will buy wholesale merchandise such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, jackets, and pajamas. This will allow him to meet the current demand for his products and he will be able to offer a greater variety to his customers, satisfying their preferences and needs. This will improve his sales and income so he can keep getting closer to his biggest goal and be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, jackets, and pajamas.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 35 years old. He has been a farmer for the past five years. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old; he is a father of 4 children.  

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 52 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monica has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Monica requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like coffee, milk, rice, spices, etc. for her business.

Monica has been in this business for 22 years; she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coffee, milk, rice, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Perla Jeniffer

texts.es:
Perla, es una joven soltera, vive junto a su madre y un hermano, se dedica a elaborar y vender bisutería y cosméticos, para cubrir sus gastos personales y aportar en los gastos familiares, está actividad la desempeña desde hace un año, no posee otro tipo de ayuda.
Comprará hilos, piedras, alambre, cadenas, cremas, lociones, labiales, etc., con lo que podre contar con los materiales para elaborar los diferentes tipos de piezas de bisutería como pulseras, anillos, collares, así como también tendrá más productos de belleza para ofrecer a sus clientes. Espera aprovechar la temporada y aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía.
Su sueño es independizarse y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Perla is a single young woman who lives with her mother and a brother.  She makes and sells trinkets and cosmetics in order to cover her personal expenses and to help with the family expenses.  Perla has been in this business for one year and receives no other type of assistance.  She will buy thread, stones, wire, chains, crèmes, lotions, lipsticks, and other items.  Perla will have cash for the materials she uses for making different types of trinkets such as 
bracelets, rings, and necklaces.  She will also have more beauty products to offer to her customers.  

Perla hopes to take advantage of this season to increase her sales and improve her financial situation.  Her dream is to become independent and buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy thread, stones, wire, chains, crèmes, lotions, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad tiene dos hijos menores de edad (de 14 y de 2 años de edad) y junto a su compañero de vida desean que ellos tengan una mejor vida. María se dedica desde hace cinco años a trabajar en la temporada de la zafra, en roza o corte de caña de azúcar. Una labor ardua pero que ella realiza para apoyar la economía de su hogar. María desea mejorar las paredes de su humilde casa sustituyendo la madera y plástico por una de lámina galvanizada y cuartones de pino en su estructura. Ya que no tiene todo el dinero para la construcción ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito para comprar la Lámina galvanizada, clavos para lámina y cuartones de madera de pino; así con el apoyo del compañero de vida realizarían las mejoras a su vivienda y cancelarían las cuotas de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and has two young children (one is 14 and the other is 2 years old). She and her husband dream that the kids can have a better life.  Maria has worked for the past 5 years during the sugar harvest season - she cuts the sugar cane.  This is arduous work but she does it in order to support her household.

Maria wants to improve the walls of her humble home by substituting the current wood and plastic for galvanized sheets and pine. She does not have the money she needs for the construction and so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners and pine. With the support of her husband, they will improve the house and then pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and pine to fix the walls of her house.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años de edad vive en terreno propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Jorge ha levantado poco a poco su humilde vivienda y a pesar de trabajar en Mantenimiento y albañilería no ha podido construir su vivienda con materiales más resistentes y duraderos. Es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para construir las paredes de su vivienda, que como se aprecia en la fotografía actualmente son de plástico negro. Espera tener el apoyo, comprometiéndose a cancelar puntualmente las cuotas que implican este crédito.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their three young children. Little by little Jorge has improved his humble home, but in spite of his work in maintenance and masonry, he has not been able to build his home with durable or strong materials.

Because of this, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI so that he can buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and wood to construct the walls of his home.  As we can see in the photo, the current walls are really just black plastic.  He hopes to receive the support and he promises to repay the loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and wood in order to build the walls of his home.

loans.name: Olga Cecilia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer carismática y noble, que ha luchado incansablemente para ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honrada. Hace muchos años aprendió el oficio de estilista en un curso de capacitación en belleza que realizó en una academia; luego comenzó a trabajar en diferentes peluquerías del municipio, donde adquirió experiencia y amplió sus conocimientos, esto la impulsó a independizarse y hace 12 años montó su propio salón de belleza en un espacio que adecuó en su vivienda; allí presta el servicio de corte, cepillado, manicure, pedicure, químicos, entre otros y así ha logrado generar ingresos para sustentar las necesidades básicas del hogar. 
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (shampoo, acondicionador, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes paras uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su actividad y poder seguir siendo productiva; pues a sus 59 años de edad, manifiesta que aún sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio y seguir haciendo lo que le gusta, porque todavía tiene energía y su edad no le impide trabajar día a día, así podrá disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y más adelante tendrá la capacidad de tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Olga is a charismatic and noble woman who has struggled ceaselessly to make her living in a dignified and honorable way. Many years ago she learned to be a stylist through a beautician course in an academy. She started to work in various hair salons in the city where she gained experience and expanded her knowledge. This made her want to work independently and 12 years ago she opened her own beauty salon in a space she adapted in her house. She offers hair cuts, brushing, manicures, pedicures, chemical skin treatments, etc. She generates the income she needs to pay the basic necessities of her household. 

With the desire to strengthen her business, Olga is requesting a loan to buy supplies wholesale ( shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish, etc.). This will allow her to continue with her work and continue being active. Even at 59 years old she says she wants to continue with her business and keep on doing what she enjoys. She still has energy and her age doesn't stop her from working day to day. This way she can enjoy better well-being and also be able to enjoy her old age without worrying about money.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Mahjabeen

texts.en:
Mahjabeen, a 23-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, son, and 2 daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is a barbar. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Mahjabeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will expand her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Mahjabeen has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. 

She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 41 years old; he is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 16. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna has been in this business for six years now.

Myrna requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
