The story of Sabiha  and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic developments clients. She is hiding her face for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy a face massage machine, chair and hair washing machine

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a villager from Kompong Speu province. She is 45 years old, and a mother of four children. Presently, all of her children are studying. To support the family, she and her husband make rice cakes to sell and they also sell firewood. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Channy has been a client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and her previous loans have helped her to improve her family's conditions and to keep her children in school. She is applying for new loan with VisionFund in order to cover school fees for her daughter, who is studying accounting at the university. She hopes that her daughter will finish her courses successfully and have a good job after graduation and that her family’s condition will continue to improve.

loans.use: To cover her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Phirun is a villager from the Doun Keo district in Takeo province. She is a mother of six children, four of whom are dependents. She farms rice and works as a teacher. She also raises pigs and cows to support the family. She has been involved in her business for 33 years, and she currently earns about 9 dollars per day. 

Phirun is applying for her sixth loan. She is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her daughter, who attends university and is majoring in accounting. She hopes that her kid can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Muhanad

texts.en:
Muhanad is a 20-year-old married man. Because of his family's low income, Muhanad left school when he was 16 and started working in agriculture to help his parents. He is a hard worker who specializes in growing palm trees and selling dates. 

Muhanad will use this loan to dig a well and buy a water pump. He hopes the loan will help him to increase his income and allow him to complete his education  

The story of Muhanad and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's support for economic development.

loans.use: to dig a well and buy a water pump .

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is 20-years-old; he lives with his parents in the village at Ramallah city, he works at a carpentry work shop as an employee.

Yazan is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and paint it.  He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house and make it better, which will enable him to live with more physical comforts.  He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs and help his parents.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave and paint his house.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo la “La Florida” conformada por 07 socias dedicadas a distintas actividades de comercio y pasan a su 08  ciclo. Aurea de 65 años separada con 07 hijos independientes. Actualmente alquila habitaciones  en su vivienda. Este negocio surgió gracias a la motivación de sus hijos, pues son ellos quienes la apoyan. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para arreglos de su vivienda y de esta manera darles una mejor atención a sus inquilinos. Más adelante piensa construir más habitaciones para poder alquilarlos. El grupo “La Florida” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.   Aurea se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The "La Florida" group is made up of seven members who make a living through various commerce jobs and are on their eighth loan cycle.  

Aurea, 65, is separated and has seven independent children.  She currently rents out rooms in her house.  This business came about thanks to the motivation of her children, because they support her.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to make repairs on her house, so that she can provide better care to her tenants.  In the future she wishes to build more rooms that she can rent.  

The "La Florida" group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible and they promise to continue working hard.  

Aurea is standing in the photo.  She is the first woman on the right and is wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, a 42-year-old married mother of three children, has been selling milk for many years. She initiated the business by buying a buffalo to help support her family at a time when her husband was the only income earner. With the passage of time her sales, along with her income, have increased, and she now has two buffalo and one cow. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income.

This has all happened due to Azra's courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters.  

Azra has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. This will be her seventh loan from Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Santos Romero

texts.es:
Santos, es acompañada, vive junto a su compañero de vida, su madre y un niño, para cubrir parte de sus gastos familiares ha puesto en práctica lo que aprendió de su madre el cual es elaborar tortillas para luego venderlas, tiene un horario de de 5: 00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., posee mucha demanda.
Con el préstamo comprara maíz, leña, gas propano, cal y bolsas, con lo que seguirá trabajando, espera aumentar su producción, dar a sus clientes un buen servicio y mejorar sus ganancias con las que seguirá aportando en los gastos de su hogar, además podrá cancelar su deuda.
Aspira a tener un negocio mucho más grande con lo que tendrá los recursos para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner, her mother and her child. In order to cover part of the family's costs, she has put into practice what she learned from her mother; that is, she makes tortillas to sell. She has a work schedule of 5am to 5pm, and there is a lot of demand.

Santos will buy maize, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags with the loan. This will allow her to continue working, She hopes to increase production, offer a good service to her customers and improve her profits, which will mean she can continue to help out with the household costs and also pay off her loan. Her dream is to have a much bigger business, which will give her the means to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past 4 years. She stitches for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. 

It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 25-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past 5 years. 

She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  Azra has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Azra is hopeful that this loan will will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 30-year-old divorced woman with 4 children. She wanted to do something to improve her income and fulfill her children's needs. She has good experience sewing clothes and she had worked at many workshops, so she decided to launch her project in this field. Faten has started a business sewing women’s clothes, and she hopes that it becomes successful. 

Faten is asking Ryada for this startup loan to buy sewing tools like fabric, threads, and a sewing machine. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period to help them get their businesses off the ground.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools like fabric, threads, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Suliman

texts.en:
Suliman is 44 years old; he lives with his wife and his five children in a village at Nablus. He works as a contractor. 

Suliman has asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and repair his ceiling, which will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair his ceiling

loans.name: Mjjli

texts.en:
Mjjli is 34-years-old.  He works in the drilling business and lives in the Tulkarem camp.

He is doing some repair work to his house to get ready for marriage, but he has a shortage of money, so he asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint the house and repair the ground.  With this, his home will reflect better living conditions and will help him to take a step forward.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair the ground.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven activa, dinámica y emprendedora de 23 años de edad, que desde muy pequeña le ha gustado hacer manualidades y cosas en las que pueda explotar su mente creativa. Es estudiante de comunicación audiovisual y además tiene su propio negocio, produce accesorios de bisutería para dama; el oficio lo aprendió viendo a un amigo que realizaba la misma labor y, comenzó a hacer algunos artículos para uso personal como un hobbie, pero luego se contactó con algunos almacenes que vieron su trabajo y les gustó, razón por la que ahora los vende; cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleadas que trabajan todos los días en la jornada de la tarde; así ha logrado generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar y para pagar sus estudios universitarios.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio, con el dinero comprará 3 mesas de trabajo, 3 sillas e insumos al por mayor (pedrería, cadenas, hilos, cintas, broches y otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y además podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes; además estará en la capacidad de adquirir nuevos contratos, mejorando los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Daniela se proyecta para un futuro a mediano plazo teniendo su taller mucho más amplio, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo y que su marca y productos sean reconocidos a nivel nacional, abriéndose paso para ser una gran distribuidora y generando mayor rentabilidad para poder disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Daniela is an active, dynamic and enterprising woman of 23 years of age who, from early on has liked crafts and things in which she can develop her creativity. She is a student in audiovisual communication and also has her own business where she makes jewelry for women. She learned this trade from a friend who carried out the same work and he started making a few items for her own use as a hobby. Later on, she contacted a few stores which saw her work and liked the goods, hence why she is now selling them, she has the support of two employees who work every day in the afternoon. In this manner, she has managed to generate an income to support her household's income and pay for her university studies.

The loan that Daniela is seeking is a means of support to improve her business; with the money from the loan, she will buy three work benches, 3 chairs and supplies in bulk (jewels, chains, threads, ribbons, broaches and so on). All of this will allow her to improve the working conditions and meet the orders that are pending as well as be in a position to earn new contracts, improving the profits that she makes through her work.

Daniela is planning for the mid-term future, owning a much larger workshop, in which she can generate more job opportunities and that her brand and products become renowned nationally, paving the way to being a large distributor and generating larger profits to enjoy a better quality of life and be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy three work benches, 3 chairs and supplies in bulk (jewels, chains, threads, ribbons, broaches and more).

loans.name: Hernán Carmelo

texts.es:
Hernán, a sus 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Hace algunos años se dedicó a criar y comercializar cerdos en sociedad con un amigo pero, luego tomó la decisión de independizarse y realizar la labor por cuenta propia para generar mejores ingresos que le permitieran pagar el estudio de sus hijos y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Con el ánimo de estabilizar las finanzas familiares, Hernán desea seguir luchando y fortalecer su negocio, por ello encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para lograrlo; el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más lechones, con el fin de aumentar su producción y poder generar mejores utilidades al momento de vender en el mercado; así estará en la capacidad de seguir apoyando a su familia económicamente y podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hernan, 58 years old, lives with his wife and four children, whom he has raised well thanks to his effort and dedication. 
Some years ago he started raising and selling pigs in partnership with a friend, but later he decided to become independent to generate more income to pay for his children's education and his household expenses.  
With the challenges of stabilizing his family finances, Hernan wants to continue strengthening his business; for this he is requesting a loan to support his goals. He will invest the money to buy more piglets, in order to increase production and to generate better earnings when he sells at the market. This way he will be able to keep on supporting his family economically and offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is a borrower from the Kandal Stoeng district in Kandal province. She is 63 years old and a widowed mother of three children.

To support the family, she has been in rice farming and selling grocery items. This business returns her about 38,000 KHR per day.  She is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and this helped her family to live a decent life and have enough food to eat.

Now she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund, and she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items for sale and to improve her farm. She hopes that her business will grow nicely and that her family will live a better life with good health.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale and to improve her farm

loans.name: Mazoza

texts.en:
Mazoza is a 53-year-old widowed woman.  She works for a manufacture near the town.

Mazoza applied for a loan from Ryada to make a separate wall between the living room and the kitchen with a ceiling because the kitchen is out of her house,  a "separated kitchen room”, so she’s suffering during the winter.  She wants to also paint the walls.  This will help her to improve the house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to make a separate wall between the living room and the kitchen with a ceiling.

loans.name: Peruanos A Trabajar Group

texts.es: Sra. Guadalupe  de 48 años de edad soltera  y madre de 3 hijos, la Sra. Guadalupe  es una mujer muy emprendedora que gracias  a sus esfuerzos a sabido superarse, la Sra. Guadalupe  tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de ropa a pedido , el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros  y así generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener más ingresos económicos y poder apoyar la educación de sus hijos. La Sra. Guadalupe  es la tercera persona esta parada para la mano izquierda se le distingue por su polo de color negro, la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva, sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 48 years old, single, and the mother of three children.  Guadalupe is an enterprising woman who has learned to get ahead thanks to her efforts.  Guadalupe has a small clothing sales business and sells on order.  It’s located in front of her house and is her family’s only source of income.

She will use the money from this loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing for resale, to generate more income so she can support her children’s education.

Guadalupe is the third person standing on the left, wearing a black polo shirt.  She is very grateful for the assistance and sends a big hug to Kiva, knowing that she will meet all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Isabel Segunda

texts.es:
Isabel, una campesina de 65 años de edad, es madre cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo hace ya varios años.
Nació en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en la agricultura y el cuidado de animales una forma de vida, sus padres le enseñaron desde pequeña a realizar todas las tareas del campo y, gracias a eso, hoy en día posee algunos cultivos y además cría y comercializa pollos y cerdos; así ha logrado generar ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos y lechones e insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y concentrado para animales), esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y por lo tanto aumentarán los ingresos por la venta de animales y la cosecha recolectada.
Isabel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando hasta que Dios y su cuerpo se lo permitan, pues le gusta ser productiva y apoyar económicamente a sus hijos; así podrá disfrutar más delante de una vejez sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Isabel, a farmer of 65 years of age, is a mother and head of the household since she separated from her husband several years ago. She was born into a humble family which found a way to make a living in agriculture and the rearing of animals. From a young age, her parents showed her how to perform all the farming tasks and it is thanks to this that today she owns a few plots of land, and in addition rears and sells chicken and pigs in order to generate a sufficient profits to support her household..

Isabel will invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of more chicken, suckling pigs and agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and animal feed), which will allow her to increase her productions and in turn the profits through the sale of animals and the harvesting of the crops. 

Isabel states that her greatest dream is to continue working for as long as the Lord and her body will allow as she likes being productive and financially supporting her children. In this manner, she will benefit from an old age free from worries in the future.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, suckling pigs, and agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and animal feed).

loans.name: Guido Antonio

texts.es:
Guido es un campesino humilde y carismático, que ha luchado incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.
Sus padres le enseñaron desde pequeño a realizar todas las tareas del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de yuca, ñame y plátanos; además cría y comercializa ganado y cerdos, la cosecha y los animales son vendidos en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, así genera los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el dinero comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y concentrado para animales), esto le permitirá tener una cosecha mucho más productiva y mejorará el precio de venta de sus productos, aumentando así el ingreso que recibe por su labor.
Guido manifiesta que su principal interés es seguir realizando sus labores, pues se han convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y además le gusta hacerlo, sólo espera poder seguir velando por el bienestar de su grupo familiar y más adelante, tener la capacidad para disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin ningún tipo de preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Guido is a humble and charismatic farmer who has tirelessly toiled to get his three children ahead in life. From a young age, his parents showed him how to perform farming activities and, it is thanks to this that today he has yucca, yam and banana crops; he also rears and sells cattle and pigs. He sells the crops that he has harvested and the animals in the market of the town in which he lives, therein generating the profits required to cover his family's basic spending.

He will invest the loan that he is seeking in strengthening the business: with the money he will buy agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and animal feed), this will enable him to have a much more productive crop and improve the selling price of his products, thus increasing the profits he makes for his work.

Guido asserts that his main interest is to continue in his work, as not only has become his only source of income, but he also enjoys it. Guido only hopes to be able to continue caring for his family and, in the future, being able to enjoy a peaceful old age free from any worries.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers and animal feed).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She has a retail business and has been in this business for 3 years. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and loaves of bread.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and loaves of bread

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 39 years old and she lives in Gandzaqar village in Tavush region. She is married and she has two children. Her son is passing his military service at the army, and her daughter is still school-aged. 

Hasmik’s husband is unemployed and he works with Hasmik farming. On their farm, they have 9 cows, 10 piglets, and 20 chickens. They also have a nice orchard of apples and figs. They sell their farm goods from their home to re-sellers.  Hasmik says she wants to become seriously engaged in swine breeding, and she wants to increase the number of her piglets.

She asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy two piglets and animal fodder for the winter period.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and animal fodder for the winter

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 37 years old. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married mother of three children all of whom are in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanarusi has operated a cashew nut selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business. With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Chumbani

texts.en:
Chumbani appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase 3 sacks of cashew nuts to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 28-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more baby goats. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is 28 years old, a married man who lives in Sana`a with his two children. 

He has been operating a grocery store for two years; he sells basic products. He started his business with supporting capital to open this grocery that would be able to support his young family. Because of his dedication to his work, he has been able to attract customers to his business. He said he needs to fill his store with more food products to serve his customers. 

So he applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy more merchandise for his store like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, eggs, oil, etc. that bring in more profit. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to open a wholesale store instead of his grocery.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store like soft drinks, mineral water, beans, biscuits, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig is a 33-year-old hardworking man. He is married a father of three children. He works at a workshop. He dresses car seats with covers.

Now, he wants to increase his stock at the shop. He needs money to do that; therefore, he has requested a loan of 1,600 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) to buy cover materials and other necessary tools for workshop.

This will help him to offer more variety to his customers. Namig will save the profits for the future needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy materials for car seat covers.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She has a hardware business and has been in it for seven years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of cement, nails, angle bars and iron sheets. She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked hardware shop, and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to  piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement, lime, nails and tins of paint.

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila is a 24-year-old married woman and mother to three children. She has been running a business selling animals for the past five years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and sells them near Eid-al-Adha (a religious holiday in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Adila has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in the village of Ninotsminda. He is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 18-year-old son in his own house. Solomon’s wife is a tailor and earns a monthly salary. Solomon is running a small agricultural business and breeds two calves. He plans to raise and sell them in the fall for a profit. 

Solomon’s family lives in poverty and he has decided to start a business to generate income. His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up loans with soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor that do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” with low income. With the credit, Solomon will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The family's income will increase and Solomon will be able to improve the living conditions of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 38 years old. He is married with six children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 49; he is married, with 4 children. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is nice woman from Yerevan. She lives with her children (ages 17 and 13 years old) and retired mother.

Elmira is a pharmacist by profession. In one of the supermarkets, Elmira rents a small pharmacy where she sells different medications. She meets all the licensing requirements, and provides high quality service to her clients. To be able to purchase a new stock of medication for her pharmacy, Elmira needs financial support. 

She took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Elmira was able to run her pharmacy business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. 

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 
This loan will greatly assist Elmira to sustain her pharmacy and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for medication to sell in her small pharmacy

loans.name: Shah  Gul

texts.en: Shah Gul is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. For the improvement of her business, she requested a Murabaha (see below) of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from the Kashf Foundation, which she utilized to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs. It helped her in attracting more customers. She wishes to spend part of the profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs

loans.name: Al-Amirat Group

texts.en:
The Al-Amirat group consists of four ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Rahab is a very active woman.  She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. She is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. She works hard to provide for her family, so she decided to apply for a 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) loan from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.en: Candelario is a married man from the town of Antequera, Bohol. He has three children, ages 14 (twins) and a 12-year-old. For ten years now, he has been engaged in raising hogs and operating a chainsaw machine. These businesses allow him to earn an average income of 4,000 Philippine pesos per month. He is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of feed and piglets to raise in order to continue his business and cover his family's basic needs. He hopes that with his business he can continue to support his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 38-year-old married woman from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. Her husband is a carpenter and they have six children together. The eldest is sixteen and the youngest is two years old. For ten years now, she has been engaged in a hog-raising business as well as farming rice. She is asking for a loan to support her business needs and buy piglets, feed and supplements so she can further expand her business. Hilda is optimistic about the future and will work hard to ensure that her children's needs are met.

She dreams of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children who attend school.  She operates a business selling clothes, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling first hand shoes and bags. She sells in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Josephine is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 500,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  She hopes to acquire more capital so as to start importing clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido a tomar un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes e insecticidas, para el cultivo de maíz, se preferencia se debe al buen servicio y facilidad de pago que le da la institución.
Con el crédito anterior pudo contar con los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz, con lo que ha aumentado la producción, mejorado las ganancias, y sus condiciones económicas son mejores.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn plantations. His choice is based on the good service and the conditions offered by the institution.

With the previous loan he could buy the agricultural supplies he needed to plant corn. As the production increases, so do his profits. His financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn plantations.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from the community of Sikatuna, Bohol. She has earned a living through rice farming and hog raising for thirteen years now. She is dependent on her businesses for income. Maria barely earns an average income of 5000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. From this loan, she can expect healthier pigs that she can market in four months' time.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm and a piggery with a sow and more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Зинат 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей, трое из них - школьники, один дошкольного возраста. Вместе с семьей Зинат проживает ее пожилая свекровь, которая помогает Зинат по уходу и воспитанию детей. У Зинат - среднее образование, сразу же после окончания школы Зинат вышла замуж за Жээнбека и они вместе начали заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зинат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 3 овцы, 3 ягненка, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,80 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зинат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зинат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Zinat is 30 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Three of the children are of school age, and one is younger. Zinat's elderly mother-in-law lives together with Zinat's family. The mother-in-law helps Zinat care for and bring up the children. 

Zinat has secondary education. She married Jeenbekov right after finishing school, and together they started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. They started 13 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zinat's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow, three sheep, three lambs and also a plot of land of 0.80 hectares, on which she grows beans and clover. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Zinat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase calves to increase the number of livestock. Zinat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se dispone a surtir su negocio para la temporada navideña en esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para comprar huevos y pollos de engorde, ya que es en esta época en la que las demandas de sus clientes aumenta.
Con el crédito anterior pudo comprar más pollos y alimentación para los mismos, con lo que su negocio cubrió los pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaron, a podido cancelar sus deudas y dar a sus familia un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en: José is arranging the stocking of his business for the Christmas season. At this time he is requesting a loan to buy eggs and chickens as this is the period when his clients demand increases. With his last loan he was able to buy more chickens and feed and his business meet the demand of his customers, his sales rose, he paid off his debt and gave his family a different life style.

loans.use: to buy eggs and chickens.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: José, tiene 30 años de edad, es casado tiene 1 hijo y vive en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua. El lleva 11 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de cal para uso domestico y para construcciones. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado a orillas de la carretera donde hay afluencia de clientes. Ha solicitado dos prestamos anteriores para su negocio y actualmente solicita otro que es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar la piedra de cal para procesarla y venderla por cantidades y libras en bolsas. El espera que la inversión le ayude a mejorar su inventario y las ventas. Su plan es seguir con el negocio par incrementar los ingresos y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, married and has a son. He lives in a village called Taulabe, in Comayagua. He has been buying and selling lime for domestic and construction use. His establishment is located by the road, which is highly frequented.

He has previously requested two loans for his business and is now requesting a new one of 15,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy limestone in order to process it and sell it packed in bags. He hopes that this investment can help him to increase his inventory and improve his sales. His plan is to continue with his business in order to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy limestone to process it and sell it.

loans.name: Mahuzar

texts.en:
Mahuzar is a 60-year-old married woman who is very hardworking and experienced. She breeds sheep for meat purposes and sells it to local butchers. Mahuzar has 31 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced farmer. 

Mahuzar usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in three to six months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar or from her yard. Meat sales provides her with 130 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in income per month. Mutton is a very popular product in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma. Mahuzar has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase fodder and lambs. This will be her third loan and she has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to purchase fodder and lambs.

loans.name: Xuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 49 years old, married, and is an IDP (internally displaced person) living with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She moved from the city of Fuzuli. Xuraman could not get a higher education and because of that decided to start her own business. She chose farming, growing fruits and vegetables in her own yard. Her husband  helps her with the farming. 

Xuraman wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover the high demand so she would like to grow more fruits and vegetables to increase her turnover as well as improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting her third loan for 1,200 AZN, which she will use  to buy farming supplies.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Этого мужчину на фотографии зовут Чамшед. Он из Куляба. Ему 40 лет. У него большая семья. Чамшед живет с родителями, женой и детьми. Он женат на Сафаргул. Они воспитывают двоих сыновей и двоих дочерей. Для Чамшеда его семья самое ценное и святое в жизни, как он сам говорит. Дети Чамшеда и Сафаргуля маленькие, а родители пенсионеры, поэтому  Чамшед кормит свою семью и старается, чтоб они не всем не нуждались. Его жена работает уборщицей в школе. Сам Чамшед занимается животноводством. Он хочет дополнительно работать таксистом, чтобы покрывать семейные расходы, которые растут. Чамшед планирует купить машину Опель-Караван и предоставлять услугу такси. Он собирается возить пассажиров по маршруту Ховалинг - Душанбе и обратно. Он надеется, что ему помогут собрать не достигающую часть кредита и купить машину.
texts.en:
The man on this photo is called Jamshed. He is from Kulyab and is 40 years old. He has a large family. Jamshed lives together with his parents, wife and children. He is married to Safargul. They are raising two sons and two daughters. Jamshed says that his family is the most valuable and sacred in life. 

Jamshed and Safargul's children are young and Jamshed's parents are pensioners, and therefore Jamshed is feeding his family and works hard so they will  not be in need of anything. His wife works as a cleaner at a school. Jamshed works with livestock breeding. He would like to work as a taxi driver in addition, in order to cover the family's expenses, which are increasing. 

Jamshed plans to purchase an Opel Caravan and provide a taxi service. He has decided to drive passengers from Hovaling to Dushanbe and back. He hopes that you will help him gather the remaining money through a loan, so he can purchase the car.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle branded Opel Caravan and start providing a taxi service

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчону 38 лет. Он из района Дж.Руми. Илхомчон примерный семьянин, лучший сотрудник и человек, заботящейся о нашей природе. Он работает в управлении по защите природы и окружающей среды, ведущим специалистом. Илхомчон любит свою работу. Дополнительно с работой он учится в Университете на агронома. Он уже на третьем курсе. Обучения является платным и у Илхомчона не хватает средств оплатить учебный год, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Он любит учиться и старается, чтобы финансовые проблемы не стали преградой в учебе и получению диплома.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 38 years old. He is from the J. Rumy region. Ilhomjon is an exemplary family man, a good employee and person who cares for nature. He works with managing the protection of nature and environment, as a leading expert. Ilhomjon loves his work. 

In addition to his work, Ilhomjon studies at the University to be an agronomist. He is already in his third year. The education has to be paid for and Ilhomjon does not have enough money to pay his tuition. For this reason he applied for a loan. He loves to study and hopes his financial problems will not become a barrier to learning and obtaining a degree.

loans.use: to pay the annual University tuition

loans.name: Mehrafruz

texts.ru: Эту милую и отзывчивую  девушку зовут Мехрафруз. Она уроженка города Душанбе. Мехрафрузе 26 лет. Она после развода с мужем живет в родительском доме. У нее не большая, но дружная семья. С ней живут ее брат, мама домохозяйка, сестра портниха, как и Мехрафуз. Мехрафруз уже 7 лет работает швеей.  Ей нравится шить, кроить и она уверенна, что это работа ее жизни. Мехрафруз хочет купить швейную машинку и работать на дому, брать заказы на шитье. Для приобретения желаемой швейной машинки у Мехрафруз не хватает средств. Она решила взять кредит с надеждой на помощь.
texts.en:
This sweet and responsive woman is called Mehrafruz. She is a native of the city of Dushanbe. Mehrafruz is 26 years old. After divorcing her husband she lives with her parents. She has a small, but friendly family. She lives together with her brother, her mother who is a housewife and her sister who is a seamstress. 

Mehrafruz is also a seamstress. She has worked with sewing for 7 years already. She likes to sew and cut, and she is confident that this work is for her. Mehrafruz would like to purchase a sewing machine and work from home, taking order to sew. Mehrafruz does not have enough money to purchase the sewing machine she wants to. She decided to take a loan and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 7 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Ann selected as the Kiva representative. Ann has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 69 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Ann is a reliable member of the community. She is married, with 2 children. Ann is 49 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 25 years to support her family. In addition to this, Ann is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and prayer group. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.	

Ann joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Ann joined One Acre Fund so that she could get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Because she wants to help more farmers, Ann has become more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Ann's life. In the future, Ann hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and repair the home.  							

Ann and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of six children and all of her children go to school. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, flour, beef, and rice. She generates additional income from selling vegetables like cabbages and fresh peas. Agnes works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Agnes' major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, green bananas, flour, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Aisha is married. She has three children and they all go to school. She doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables at the market and has been in this business for 2 years. 

Aisha has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bunches of green bananas, passion fruits, oranges, pineapples, onions and sweet potatoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells only on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to go to villages for green bananas. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, passion fruits, oranges, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 6 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Peninah selected as the Kiva representative. Peninah has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 73 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Peninah is married and has 5 children. She is 52 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and savings group. Peninah has been a farmer for 30 years. She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  			

Peninah first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Peninah joined One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods and to earn enough to feed family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Peninah plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and to buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Peninah’s own life has improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family. Peninah is also involved in the community's fishpond.  							
  							
Peninah and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero sin hijos a cargo. Originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica al negocio de molino; el cual lo inicio hace cuatro años con un solo molino. Luego poco a poco con las ganancias obtenidas fue comprando otros dos. Hoy en día cuenta con  tres molinos, que con mucho esfuerzo y empeño ha logrado salir adelante. Su meta próxima es seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de los clientes y brindando un mejor servicio. Solicita el crédito para comprar unos cernidores para colar harina, cereales, etc., con el fin de ofrecer un servicio de calidad.  Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que crecerá su negocio y clientela, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su local.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old, single and has no children. He is originally from the city of Estelí. He owns a mill, which he opened four years ago with only one machine. After a while and with the profits he made, he bought two more. He has today three machines, and he is getting ahead with hard work and perseverance.

His goal is now to continue meeting his customers’ demands and to improve the service he provides. He is requesting a loan to buy sieves to sift flour, cereals, etc. and offer a high-quality service. He believes this loan will be good for him and that both his business and his client base will grow, which will result in better profits. His goal for the future is to make some improvements to his establishment.

loans.use: to buy sieves to sift flour, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Elsi Veronica

texts.es:
Elsi, está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida, debido a la necesidad de generar más ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, por iniciativa propia instalo un atienda en su residencia, inicia sus labores de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.
El crédito lo utilizar para comprar variedad de bebidas, pan, golosinas, jabón, azúcar, entre otros, con lo que espera tener fortalecida su tienda, aumentar sus ventas, tener satisfechos a sus clientes y mejorar su economía
Sueña con tener un negocio con un inventario que le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Elsi is in a common-law relationship and lives with her life companion. Due to the need to generate more income to help pay the household expenses she opened a store in her residence on her own initiative. She is open from 6 am until 4pm.

Elsi will use the loan to buy a variety of drinks, bread, sweets, soap, sugar, etc. She hopes to strengthen her business, increase her sales, keep her customers satisfied and improve her finances. She dreams of having a business with an inventory that allows her to generate the income necessary to continue supporting her life companion with the expenses of the household.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks, bread, sweets, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre de 35 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 8 años, a quien ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente, haciendo reparaciones de artículos en cuero, esta actividad la aprendió por medio de la observación y se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos; lleva muchos años realizando la labor y por ello ya es reconocido en el sector, además reparte volantes publicitarios en otros barrios aledaños con el fin de atraer nuevos clientes y poder generar mejores ingresos para sustentar las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Solicita su primer crédito con el ánimo de comprar materia prima al por mayor (retazos de cuero, hilos, agujas, betún para cuero, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de insumos para cumplir con los trabajos que le encargan y así entregar el artículo de manera oportuna a sus clientes. 
Leonardo se proyecta hacia el futuro, cambiando el lugar de residencia, para ubicarse en una zona más visible y que sea de fácil acceso para sus clientes, así podrá mejorar las ventas y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y una educación de mayor calidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 35 years old, married, and the father of 8 children who he has gotten ahead with great effort.

During his lifetime he has worked on his own, repairing leather items, and learned this by watching.  This has become his main source of income and he has been doing this for many years, so he is well known in the area.  He also passes out flyers in other adjacent neighborhoods in order to attract new customers and generate more income to support his family.

He is asking for his first loan to buy supplies in quantity (leather, thread, needles, leather polish, etc.).  This will allow him to fill his customer orders and have items on hand.

Leonardo looks to the future, changing his residence so he can be in a more visible location and accessible to his customers.  This way his sales will improve and he can provide his family with better living conditions for his family and a better education for his son.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan is a 24-year-old  housewife and mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She received education up to class VI (grade 6).  Her husband, Rashidul, age 30, is a farmer, who attended school up to class IX (grade 9). They have one son and one daughter.  One of them goes to school (grade 2); the other is below the school-going age. They live in the small village Barosia in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Nurjahan is a courageous woman with a strong desire to get ahead in her life. She helps her husband in his agricultural activities after managing her household work. 

Now they want to start potato cultivation. Nurjahan came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds and manure to start potato cultivation on their own plot of land.  Potatoes are in great demand in the present market.

Nurjahan's plan for the future is to help her husband financially, to run the family well and to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they become professionals with better opportunities in life.

She hopes to buy a plot of land with the profit from her business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and manure to start cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Aklima

texts.en:
Aklima is a woman of 29 years. She is married to Hamidar, 39. She is a housewife while her husband is a farmer. She received education up to class V (grade 5) and her husband up to class VIII (grade 8). They have five children. Everyone is studying in school in different classes, except one, who is too small to go to school. They live in a remote area of Dhupguri in a small house made of mud and straw. Her husband is the only income provider for her family. 

They have their own plot of land where her husband cultivates many kinds of crops. As the plot belongs to them, the whole profit comes to them only. 

Aklima needs the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and useful supplies for potato cultivation, so that she can enhance their business and can also grow another variety of vegetables to earn more. 

She hopes to give a good future to her children and wants to buy a tractor for better farming with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and useful supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 32 years old and a single mother of one child. She lives in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. Blessing is well-known for her passion to help people in her community. She volunteers as a community health trainer in the district and works both in and out of schools educating people about health issues. Blessing is now a certified Core Trainer, training Camfed Learner Guides who work at high schools teaching academic and life skills. She is also currently running her poultry business which she started in 2012. She produces about 120 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in in her community. 

Blessing would very much like to increase her sales and expand her business. With a Kiva loan, she can purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost her sales. Improving her business will enhance her life considerably and she will be able to put her child and two additional dependents through school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is single and has two children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Cynthia is now an established businesswoman. She is a seamstress in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been actively involved in this business for about fifteen years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Cynthia uses her income to provide for the entire family, particularly her two children. 

Cynthia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia wants to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is married with two children and her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 300 000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, treatments, shampoo and braids. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. 

Jackie's major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair shampoo, treatments, oils and packets of hair rollers.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza de 50 años de edad es soltera, vive con su padre no tiene   hijos  que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta abarrotería, golosinas, paletas, tamales, comida y sopas, tiene casa propia y sus clientes le visitan en su casa para comprar sus golosinas.
Doña Maritza su préstamo anterior tenía una pulpería que la cerro por razones de enfermedad de su padre y hoy solo se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas y comida.
Doña Maritza está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos alimenticios como plátanos, papas, queso, tortillas, carne de pollo, arroz, etc. ya que desea surtir su negocio, con el apoyo del préstamo espera y tener  mejores ingresos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su sexto  préstamo que solicita.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2013
texts.en:
Maritza is 50 years old, is single and has no children who depend on her. She lives with her father. For the past 6 years she has been selling groceries, sweets, popsicles, tamales, meals and soup. She has her own house and her clients visit her to buy her products. With her last loan Maritza had a small store which she closed because her father was sick. Today she sells sweets and meals.

Maritza is requesting a loan to buy food products like plantains, potatoes, cheese, tortillas, chicken, rice, etc. as she wants to stock her business. With the help of the loan she hopes to improve her sales and make more profit. She is happy to continue working with Prisma with this 6th loan she has requested.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- November 2013

loans.use: to buy plantains, potatoes, cheese, tortillas, chicken, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco, aged 33 years, is married and has three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the farm production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 43 years old, married, and has five children. He has been farming for the past five years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he hopes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Elias Ismael

texts.es:
Elías, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en la compra de bujías, retenedores, cables y pastillas de frenos, con lo que tendrá los materiales necesarios para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y fomentar su fidelidad hacia el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo una ayuda para incrementar sus ganancias, fortalecer su negocio, atrajo nuevos clientes y ha mejorado su economía con lo que ha podido cancelar su crédito y ha construido una galera en la que guarda las motos.
texts.en:
Elías needs to buy spark plugs, seals, cables and brake pads. He will then have everything he needs to continue offering his clients a good service and keep their loyalty.

With the previous loan he could increase his profits, strengthen his business, attract new clients and improve his financial situation. He was able to pay the loan and build a shelter where he keeps the motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spark plugs, seals, cables and brake pads.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika, 27 years old, is a housewife. Her husband, Rajen, 32 years old, is engaged in the business of supplying wood to building contractors.  Monika has a education up to class V (grade 5), but her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.  They have two children.  Of them, the son is receiving education in class II (grade 2).  The daughter is below school-going age.  They live in the small village Anandanagar in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri, in their own kachha house (mud and straw made).

Her husband is the only earning member of their family. Monika’s husband's income is not sufficient to provide the necessities of the family. Monika desires to give financial assistance to her husband. She plans to grow potatoes and sell them to the local market. She also plans to prepare potato chips in her home and sell them to the locality to generate more income.

Monika has taken the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes on their own piece of land.  As it is a very essential vegetable, it has great demand in the present market.  So she hopes to earn a great profit from this business.

With the earning she will pay some household expenses, her children's educational expenses and with the rest she hopes to purchase land in future. She is thankful to the lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers  to start cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Babli

texts.en:
Babli is 25 years old, married and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her husband, Nripen, is 33 years old and a farmer by profession. They live in a small village Noth Khagrabari in the district Jalpaiguri. Both Babli and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are students of class V (grade 5) and class III ( grade 3) respectively. They have their own concrete house.

Babli's husband has spent all his life in the fields, where he has grown different vegetables like beans, onions, potatoes, etc., which he sells in the local market. 

Babli wants to support her husband financially by doing her own business. She decided to start a milk supply business in her locality as there is a great demand for milk. Due to lack of capital she is unable to start her business.

Babli heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives loans to the rural women to start new businesses, and she applied for a loan to purchase a cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.  The milk and the milk products (curds, butter, paneer, etc.) will be sold to the locality. In this way she will be able to generate sufficient income to support the household and her husband.

Babli wants to continue tirelessly working to advance in her business and hopes to be able to achieve her goal to give her children good education and offer her family a better quality of life with the profit from her business.

Her gives hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a new business of milk supply and dairy products.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is 35 years old and her husband, Subodh, is 35 years old. They live in a small village of Dhupguri with their two children. One child is in class I (grade 1) while another is below school-going age. She is a dedicated housewife, working hard throughout the day for her family. Her husband has engaged in farming to earn money for the family. 

They have a plot of land to farm, but the earning is not sufficient to bear the expenditure of the family. They cannot even effort the basic needs of their family, so Dipali made a plan to take a loan of 15,000 INR to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to start farming potatoes in their own field and sell the harvest to the local village market. She thinks cultivation of potatoes is a profitable business due to the great demand for potatoes in West Bengal as well as throughout India, and it will enable them to earn more money to support her family financially.
 
She will be thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Idah is 30 years old. She is married and lives in the city of Harare, Zimbabwe. She volunteers at community centers in the city, where she assists differently-abled people. She moved from Buhera district to the capital city in search of a market for her products. She has a stall in Harare where she sells hair brushes, combs, socks, makeup kits, sewing threads and mirrors. She started her business when her family began facing financial hardships in 2008. 

Idah will use the Kiva loan to improve her sales and to grow her business by purchasing more hair brushes, combs, socks, makeup kits, sewing threads and mirrors. This will enable her to cater to her family’s needs and to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her stall.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 29 years old, married, with two children. She is a passionate volunteer in her community and works as a community health trainer, devoted to spreading information on health issues. She lives in Gokwe North, Zimbabwe, where she provides for her family by buying and selling second-hand clothes. She sells clothing accessories, such as jeans, jackets, shirts, and shoes to her community. 

With a Kiva loan, Getrude will open a stall at the local flea market. This will assist her in diversifying her business, by allowing her to buy new clothes to sell, at a higher profit, in addition to her second-hand collection. She intends to purchase jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. 

She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and to get medical support for her child, who has a heart problem.

loans.use: to open a stall at the local flea market where she will sell clothes.

loans.name: Servanda Del Socorro

texts.es: Servanda es originaria de la ciudad de León, de 51 años de edad.  Casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería para bebes. Inicio este negocio hace muchos años, con unos cuantos juguetes y ropa de bebes. Poco a poco fue comprando mercadería como coches y andariveles. Actualmente cuenta con mucha mercadería de bebes para ofertar. Su meta próxima es comprar más productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: coches, tinas de baños, ropas de bebes, pañales entre otros, con el fin de surtir la mercadería en su negocio. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a crecer un poco más en su negocio y crecer su mercadería.  Su plan futuro es seguir incrementando su inventario y las ventas.
texts.en:
Servanda is a 51 year old native of Leon. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She is a merchant who sells products for babies. She started this business many years ago with a few toys and baby clothing. Little by little she began to buy merchandise like strollers and trinkets.

Today she has lots of infant products for sale. Her next goal is to buy more products. She has requested a loan to buy strollers, bathtubs, baby's clothing, diapers, etc. with the goal of stocking her business.
