María, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus hijos de 8, 7 y 6 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de contribuir en los gastos familiares se dedica a sus negocio que consiste en una tienda y una granja de pollos, ubicadas en su residencia lo que le facilita estar al pendiente de ambas actividades, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 7:30 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de pollos, azúcar, jabón, maíz, bebidas, etc., con lo que fortalecerá la granja y la tienda, espera responder positivamente a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus ingresos para cubrir las cuotas de la deuda y seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más rentable para cambiar el estilo de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Maria and her husband have three children, 8-, 7- and 6- years old, respectively.  She operates two businesses, a corner grocery and a poultry business.  She runs both businesses from space in her house and yard, so she can easily go back and forth from one to the other.  She generally works from 6:00am to 7:30pm.
Maria will use this loan to buy chickens, sugar, soap, maize, soft drinks, etc.  The investment will allow her to grow the two businesses and meet demand for everything she sells.  Her earnings from the businesses will both cover her debt payments and provide more income for her family.  For the future, Maria wants to make the businesses more profitable so that she can better help those she loves most.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Astrid Carolina

texts.es:
Su nombre es Astrid, estudiante administración hotelera. Recurre a este medio para solicitar la ayuda de Kiva debido que se siente muy triste porque no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes debido a que esta pagando mensual cuotas altas  y no le alcanza, quiere continuar y por eso recurre a ustedes para que le den una ayuda con el préstamo ya que ella necesita salir adelante y acabar sus estudios.  Ella se siente muy cómoda con la carrera que escogió y quiere continuar con sus estudios a nivel profesional, entiende que este es el primer paso y que aun faltan muchos por dar, pero esta convencida de que lo puede hacer.
Pide que tengan en cuenta esta solicitud que es esencial para ella, para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y continuar con los compañeros del programa gracias.
texts.en:
Her name is Astrid, a student of hotel administration. She is turning to this method to request help from Kiva because she is feeling very sad since she cannot count on sufficient financial resources because she is paying high monthly fees and these resources are not enough.

 She wants to continue, and because of this she is turning to you for help through a loan since she needs to get ahead and finish her studies. She is very comfortable with her career choice and she wants to continue with her studies at the professional level. She understands that this is the first step and that she still has many to get through, but she is convinced that she can do it.

She asks that you keep in mind this request that is key for her to be able to provide a better quality of life to her family and continue with her program classmates. Thank you.

loans.use: to pay educational costs.

loans.name: Wendy Natali

texts.es: Había una vez una niña  llamada  Natali, ella acababa de salir del colegio, la niña tenía  la esperanza  de ingresar a la educación superior, pero sus sueños no pudieron ser realidad, sus padres  de pocos recursos y con una familia numerosa no pudieron costener sus estudios. Por tal motivo la niña empezó a enviar hojas de vida  para temporada estudiantil, la llamaron de una papelería y librería del sector, Natali aprovechó la oportunidad y fue tan buena vendedora, que el  dueño de la librería la deja trabajando como fija, ella empieza ahorrar y abre una cuenta de ahorros.  Luego de seis meses en la librería y la niña le dice  a su  madre  "mami  quiero estudiar" la mamá le dice: hija hoy pasaron unos jóvenes repartiendo volantes de una institución de educación. El día de descanso se dirigió a aquel lugar con su madre y ve que es lo que quiere, así que ella empieza a estudiar técnico en mercadeo y ventas y el dueño de la librería le dice que la felicita por quererse superar y la deja trabajando medio tiempo, por lo tanto sus ingresos ya no son los mismos, la joven realiza parte de su  carrera pero llega al punto de hacer sus pasantías pero no le queda tiempo para seguir trabajando entonces se  retira de la librería y sus padres le aportan en sus estudios muy poco, es por eso que acude a kiva.
texts.en: Once upon a time there was a girl named Natali. When she finished high school, she had hoped to continue on to higher education, but her dreams did not come true: Her parents, with a large family and few resources, could not pay for her studies. So the girl began sending out her resume to find seasonal student employment. She found a job at a neighbourhood book and stationary store. Natali took advantage of the opportunity and was such a good seller, that the owner had her stay on as a permanent employee. She began to save and opened a savings account. After six months working in the bookstore, the girl told her mother "Mom, I want to study." Her mother replied: "Daughter, today a few young people came by handing out flyers about an institute." On her day off, she went to the school with her mother to decide. That's how she started studying technical marketing and sales. The owner of the bookstore congratulated her for wanting to be successful and he allowed her to continue working part-time. As a result, her income was no longer the same. The girl completed a portion of the program, reaching the part that required her to do an internship. She no longer had time to continue working, so she left her job at the bookstore. Her parents contribute very little to her studies, so she has come to Kiva.

loans.use: pay for her education.

loans.name: Yeni Yohana

texts.es: Hola amigos de Kiva, primero que todo Yohana les da las gracias por el apoyo que le han brindado en los dos primeros semestres de su programa de cosmetología y estética,  ya que sin su apoyo no hubiera sido posible estudiar, y afortunadamente ya se encuentra culminando por lo cual es muy importante y de gran ayuda seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes para poderse graduar  y terminar uno de sus sueños  que es ser esteticista y seguirse formado profesionalmente hasta que Dios se lo permita.  Ahora ya ve muy cerca la primera meta de muchas que están por venir, el próximo paso es continuar con el nivel de profesionalización y lograr abrir su propio consultorio.
texts.en: Hello, friends of Kiva. First of all, Yohana gives you thanks for the support that you have offered her in the first two semesters of her program in cosmetology and esthetics, since without your support it would not have been possible to go to school. Fortunately, she is finishing, for which it is very important and a great help for her to continue having your support to be able to graduate and achieve one of her dreams, which is to be an esthetician and continue developing professionally as far as God allows her. Now she sees that the first of many goals is very near, and the next step is to continue with her level of professionalism and manage to open her own office.

loans.use: to pay for education costs

loans.name: Sindy Pamela

texts.es: Sindy, tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella tiene dos años de haber establecido una pulpería donde vende azúcar, arroz, manteca, café, pastas, harina, achinería, pan, refrescos, dulces, churros y otros. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería con mas productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, pastas, refrescos etc. Su meta es mantener en crecimiento el negocio para ayudar al sustento familiar.
texts.en: Sindy, 22, is married and has one child.  She lives in Olanchito, a town in Yoro.  She started a corner grocery two years ago and sells sugar, rice, butter, coffee, pastas, flour, bread, soft drinks, snacks and other merchandise.  She is now applying for a 10,000 lempiras loan that she will use to stock her grocery with products that she will resell.  For the future, Sindy wants to grow the business and establish it as a means of supporting her family.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Nancy

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante y carismática, a sus 36 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Cuando quedó en embarazo de su primer hijo tomó la decisión de trabajar para adquirir ingresos por cuenta propia y ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, por ello inició una guardería en la que cuida los niños del ICBF y así ha logrado ganarse la vida sin descuidar a su familia y ha generado ingresos suficientes durante los 18 años que lleva en funcionamiento el establecimiento.
Su propósito con el crédito que solicita es realizar unas adecuaciones locativas que le permitan seguir velando por el bienestar de los niños que están a su cargo.
Luz manifiesta que además de generar ingresos para su familia le gusta realizar su actividad porque tiene un sentido social, pues se involucra en la vida de los niños que cuida, brindándoles amor y compañía que en ocasiones no reciben en sus hogares, esto la llena de vida para seguir luchando incansablemente y brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida e inculcarles valores para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luz is a dynamic and charismatic woman. She is 36 years old and has four children that she provides for through a lot of effort and dedication. When she found herself pregnant with her first child, she made the decision to work in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses. She started a daycare where she looks after children from the ICBF [Colombian Institute for Family Welfare] and this has allowed her to earn a living without neglecting her family. She has generated a decent income during the 18 years she has run this business. 

Luz plans to use the loan to carry out some renovations to ensure the continued well-being of the children in her care. She states that besides the fact that this work generates income to support her family, she likes it due to its benefit to society; she is involved in the lives of the children that she cares for, providing them with love and attention that they sometimes don't receive in their own homes. This fills her with life and allows her to continue pushing ahead tirelessly and providing her children with a better quality of life, as well as instilling values in them so that they will be good people.

loans.use: to carry out renovations.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. She is married and has six children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Ekua is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer and a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Elizabeth did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Elizabeth sells bread and beverages in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about 14 years. As a divorcee with four children, Elizabeth uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of bread and beverages, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bread and beverages, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling secondhand clothing in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Elizabeth is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of secondhand clothing. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises operates a sari-sari (variety store) in Trinidad, Bohol.  Moises has been in this business for several years. This is the source of his income.

Moises is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings to sell. With this loan, he will be able to increase his inventory and therefore attract more customers. Moises dreams of making his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells charcoal in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a widow with five children, Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells smoked fish in Asafa (near Elmina). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 17 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que su padre falleció y a él le toco ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, así que tubo que empezar a trabajar. Esta acompañado, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 2 hijas, quines lograron  terminar sus estudios de educación media, gracias a la ayuda de sus padres.

Desde que dejo la escuela, José inicio a trabajar como corralero en una hacienda, le tocaba ordeñar alimentar y cuidar de las vacas. Ahora esta encargado, de vigilar el equipo de bombeo de los cañales. Ahí tiene 15 años de trabajar, sus turnos son de 24 horas continuas de trabajo y 24 horas de descanso.

Con el préstamo se estará ayudando a que  pueda comprar lamina y logre mejorar el techo de su vivienda, el cual a quedado dañada a causa del invierno y de los fuertes vientos que azotan en esta época. 

A José le gustaría continuar estudiando en la educación básica, ya que reconoce que el estudio es muy importante para lograr superarse, también tiene el sueño de tener energía eléctrica en su casa, para que las condiciones de vida mejoren. Pero sabe que solo esforzándose por seguir adelante, lograra cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jose, 51, left school after the 6th grade because his father died and his mother needed his help to make ends meet.  He and his wife, a homemaker, have 2 daughters, both of whom have finished school thanks to help from their parents.  

Jose worked on a ranch after he left school, herding, feeding and tending cattle.  He now inspects pumps for the local irrigation authority.  He's worked there for 15 years and his schedule requires him to work for 24 hours straight with the next 24 hours off.  

Jose will use this loan to pay for materials that he needs to rebuild his roof.  The roof suffered over the winter from strong winds that are common here then.  

Jose would like to finish school because he knows how important education is for getting ahead.  He would also like to install electricity because it would improve his living condition.  He knows, he says, the importance of hard work for meeting your goals.

loans.use: to pay for building materials that he will use to improve his house.

loans.name: Abaya

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abaya did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Abaya sells smoked fish in Asafa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Abaya is married to a farmer and they have two children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Abaya has identified that there are growing demands for her product among consumers. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs, due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more smoked fish to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Abaya wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Jalloh Street Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Jalloh Street” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective  businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abubakarr is the featured leader of this group. A 48-year-old father of five children who are attending primary and secondary school, Abubakarr has been selling fish for many years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 36 años edad y tiene tres hijos. 

Ana Maria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida típica de la región del cusco, ella sigue teniendo su pequeño restaurante o puesto de venta en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, verduras y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Ana María's a hardworking and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead.  She's 36 years old and has three children.

Ana María is grateful to the lenders for the loan and happy about the support.  She still sells traditional food from the Cusco region in her small restaurant or food stall in one of the main markets in the city of Paucartambo.  She has been working in this business for several years now and it's going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her job.

She needs this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, vegetables, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Folly mécanicien auto exerce son activité dans un garage depuis 2010. Mariée, il est père d'un enfant de 05ans scolarisé. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter un appareil mécanique. Il souhaite aménager son garage et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Folly is a car mechanic and has been working in a garage since 2010. He is married and has a five-year old child who attends school. To help his business to progress, he requests a first loan to buy a mechanic tool. He hopes to equip his garage and take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic tool.

loans.name: Fungai

texts.en:
Fungai is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Chikomba West where she sells poultry and eggs. She produces about 120 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in her community. Fungai volunteers in schools in her village as a Camfed community health trainer where she spreads information about various health issues. She wants to increase her sales and expand her business. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to purchase more chicks and chick feed to increase her production. An improvement in her business means she will be able to enroll her children in a good school and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Ndaiziveyi

texts.en:
Ndaizivei, a 25-year-old married mother of two, lives in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe where she rents a grocery shop selling items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationary. Ndaizivei inspires young women in her community as both a Cama community health trainer  and as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for two years and has managed to support herself and her children. 

Ndaizivei will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing stocks at her store. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits céréaliers et alimentaires à domicile, madame Améyo âgée de 47ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter un avenir radieux à sa famille(mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 02 enfants). A l’approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de garder ses clients. Améyo désire développer son activité et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Améyo sells cereal and food products from home. She is 47 years old and struggles every day to offer a radiant future to her family. She is married to a driver and has two children. Just before the end of the year festivities she requests a second loan to buy merchandise in order to keep her customers. Améyo would like to develop her business and take care of her family's health.

loans.use: To buy cereal and food products.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia continua dedicándose a la venta de comida y teniendo su pequeño restaurante o pollería donde prepara ricos plato de comida y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos, carne, papas, verduras y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  

Florencia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 28 años edad y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Florencia continues to make a living running a restaurant where she sells delicious meals.  The business is going well and, on this occasion, Florencia is applying for a loan in order to buy more supplies, such as chicken, meat, potatoes, vegetables and other items.  Florencia is part of the "Mamacha Carmen" communal bank and she is grateful for and knows the value of this loan.  Florencia promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

Florencia is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is prospering.  She is 28-years-old and has one son.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chickens, meat, potatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Djekra

texts.fr: Djekra mécanicien auto exerce son activité dans un garage depuis 2000. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants de 02ans et 1an. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des pièces détachées. Il souhaite aménager son garage et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Djekra is an automobile mechanic and has worked in a garage since the year 2000. He is married with two children of two years and one year. To help his business to progress, he requests a first loan to buy spare parts. He hopes to equip his garage and take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Adévi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale, Adevi a pour mari un imprimeur et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Elle revend ses marchandises dans une boutique et fait sa troisième demande de prêt pour acheter plus produits afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite mieux augmenter son stock et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille. Elle a 50ans avec une ancienneté d'1 an dans l'activité.
texts.en: Adevi sells general food products. She is married to a printer and has four children, three of whom go to school. She sells her merchandise in a shop and requests this third loan to buy more stock in order to meet the demands of her clients. She would like to increase her stock and ensure her family's well-being. She is 50 years old and has been in this business for one year.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Cruz es una mujer pujante y activa, madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar, luego de atravesar por un difícil momento tras la separación de su esposo.
Durante 8 años trabajó como empleada doméstica en la casa de unos padres salesianos, pero en el año 2012 se le presentó la oportunidad de tomar en subarriendo un local que estaba acreditado para vender comidas rápidas, ella lo tomó y poco a poco lo fue convirtiendo en charcutería e incluyó la venta de licor, pues la zona en la que se encuentra ubicado se presta para tal actividad; trabaja sola todos los días de 10 am a 10 pm y los fines de semana recibe el apoyo de una hija; esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
El propósito del crédito es invertir en el negocio, comprando surtido al por mayor (carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, entre otros), esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de sus clientes, logrando aumentar las ventas y el margen de ganancias.
Cruz tiene como meta conservar su negocio, acreditarlo y posicionarlo en el sector, para que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica con la que pueda sacar adelante a su hija menor y brindar mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz is a vigorous and active woman, mother to 3 children and the head of the household. She suffered a difficult period after separating from her husband. For eight years she worked as domestic help for a house of Salesian priests. 

But in 2012 the opportunity presented itself to sub-lease a shop that is licensed to sell fast food. She took it and little by little has changed it into a deli, including the sales of liquor. The area it is located in is suitable for this activity. She works by herself every day from 10 am until 10 pm and on week-ends one of her daughters helps her. She learned the business by doing it and it has become the only source of income to support her daughters. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in the business, buying supplies wholesale (cold meats, bread, sauces, soft drinks, beer, liquor, etc.). This will allow her to meet the demands and varied tastes of her customers, managing to increase her sales and margin of profit. Cruz's goal is to hold on to her business, make it well-known and position it in the local market, so that it is profitable. This will guarantee her financial stability which she can get her younger daughter ahead and offer a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (cold meats, bread, sauces, soft drinks, beer, liquor, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se decidió por otro crédito por que necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y semilla, para sembrar y  tener una buena cosecha con granos de calidad y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro concentrado para la ganadería y adquirir una vaca, lo que le ayudo a tener un negocio muy fortalecido, mejoro sus ventas, cuenta con clientes más satisfechos, sus ventas mejoraron y su economía es más estable.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan as he needs to buy manure, fertilisers, insecticides and seeds in order to sow his land and have a good harvest, have quality grains and thus fulfil his customers' orders.

José used his previous loan to buy cattle feed and to buy a cow.  This helped him to strengthen his business and improve his sales.  His customers are more satisfied and his financial situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilisers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Melanea

texts.es: Melania es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, la cual le ha permitido salir adelante con los planes familiares. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que cuenta con su negocio próspero y diversificado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: azúcar, arroz, aceite, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer los productos que más demanda la clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cumplir con sus planes y crecer su mercadería.
texts.en: Melania is originally from the city of Estelí.  She is a businesswoman and owns a grocery store, which has allowed her to do well with her plans for her family.  Melania is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito and she has a prosperous business and has diversified her product range.  Melania is applying for a loan in order to buy sugar, rice, oil and more, so that she can sell the products that are most in demand.  Melania believes that the loan will be of great help to her as she will be able to carry out her plans and expand her range of products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil and more.

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a 28-year-old woman, staying in Wedza district. She is married and a mother of one. She is an entrepreneur. 

Sinikiwe is currently running a beverage store, selling refreshments in her local town. She started the business when she was 20 years old, after realizing that she needed to be economically empowered to succeed in anything in her community. She inspires other young women in her community.

Sinikiwe will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing stocks at her store. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and to provide for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her beverage store.

loans.name: Mata De Palma 1 Group

texts.en:
Gisela is the coordinator of the group "Mata de Palma en Desarrollo" group 1 (Palm tree in development). They are named this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes five micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Gisela is very excited to receive her 15th loan with Esperanza International, after having repaid her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about eight years. She started it when she took her first loan. Gisela plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women accessories)

loans.name: Chuguexalense Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuguexalense,” located in a very remote rural area of Chichicastenango, Guatemala, is composed of eight women whose average age is 39 years. The average number of children that the women have is four. Most of them have not completed primary school and are hungry for new knowledge. The ladies mainly work in textile production. They weave and embroider beautiful handmade traditional textiles. They are requesting loans to purchase additional supplies and grow their businesses.

Rosenda is a 27-year-old married member of the Trust Bank. She has three children who range in age from four to seven years. Rosenda and her husband are business partners. She is a weaver and makes beautiful traditional handmade blouses called “huipiles.” Her husband is a tailor and sews t-shirts, shirts and pants. Rosenda has expanded her business so that she can help her husband cover househould expenses. Rosenda is requesting a new loan with Friendship Bridge in order to purchase several colors of thread for her weaving and fabrics for her husband’s textile business. Both of them want to take advantage of the year-end holidays and meet the increased demand from their customers.

There are many benefits, besides loans, offered to clients in a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. As Rosenda has been a client for several years, she has participated in the monthly trainings which have focused on topics like business administration, money management, women’s health, children’s education, self-esteem and nutrition. As she has not had very much education, these trainings are vital to her growth and the success of her family and business life.

Rosenda, along with her fellow Trust Bank members, wants to express her appreciation to Kiva investors throughout the world. The financial capital that they receive in the form of small loans is received with much gratitude. These loans, combined with the educational trainings, expand so many opportunities for these women. Empowered, they can step into a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: To purchase several colors of thread and fabrics to make clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a small-scale fisherman in Asafa (near Elmina). He has had some form of formal education, as he is a middle school graduate. He is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Peter has been working as a fisherman for close to ten years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to improve his boat and increase the amount of nets, thus allowing him to increase his fishing capacity. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to further his family from poverty and ensure that all of his children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to improve his boat and increase the amount of nets, thus allowing him to increase his fishing capacity.

loans.name: Panajachelense Group

texts.en:
From Panajachel, Guatemala we present the Friendship Bridge trust bank Panajachelense (meaning "people from Panajachel"), which was established about five years ago. Currently it is made up of eight women looking forward with positivity. Panajachel is a touristy place and many local people, such as these ladies, are engaged in commerce. Most of the members of this group are engaged in selling clothes, perfumes, cosmetics, jewelry, and food.

One of the group’s members since the beginning is Luisa, 52 years old. She had no opportunity to attend school even for a single day. She married very young and had a total of 12 children, whom she and her husband pulled forward. Currently her two youngest children depend on her. For this reason she is devoting her time to various economic activities such as selling perfumes, jewelry, and clothing. She also owns a small shop for daily consumption. Luisa intends to use the year-end holiday to sell a bit more. She is applying for a new loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy products such as perfumes, new jewelry designs, and seasonal clothing to fill more of her shop. Luisa is positive that she will do very well in her sales, so she will make a bit more income. She will be able to save some money for her children’s inscription fee and uniforms for next year, as they will start fifth and eighth grades.

These women have an average age of 35. Most of them did not reach high school. They appreciate the opportunity of the loans given by Kiva investors through Friendship Bridge, as it helps them engage in productive activities and generate income for their families. They want to support their husbands and move forward together, providing a better life for their children, and above all, provide them the opportunity of development through education.

loans.use: To buy products such as perfumes, jewelry, and seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso de Huaycan” 09 socios responsables y trabajadores, la cual pasan a su 08 ciclo. Angélica una madre emprendedora de 40 años casada con 05 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, negocio que viene siguiendo junto con su pareja. Esto le ha permitido seguir mejorando cada día. Su siguiente préstamo lo destinará para la compra de piezas de repuestos de motos. El anhelo de Angélica es de mejorar su negocio. El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso de Huaycan” agradece por colaborar en su progreso. Angélica se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color verde y en brazos lleva a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
The group "Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" are 9 responsible and hard-working associates who are applying for an eighth loan. Angelica is 40 years old and married. She is an entrepreneurial mother with 5 children, 2 of which are still dependents. She makes a living selling replacement parts for motorcycles, a business that she continues together with her partner. This business has allowed her to continue improving her life. This next loan would be for the purchase of motorcycle replacement parts. Her dream is to improve her business. 

The group "Esperanza y Progreso de Huaycan" is grateful for the collaboration in their progress. Angelica is seated, first from the left in a green polo and carrying her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Ma. Anabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Anabelle is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Ma. Anabelle operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place.
Ma. Anabelle is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like noodles, canned goods, soda and coffee, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales and profit.  In the future, Ma. Anabelle hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like noodles, canned goods, soda and coffee, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Malungu's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Magadju est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Pendeza », entrepreneur, âgée de 24 ans  et mère de 3 enfants, qui 2 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse de poulets et des œufs.   Elle installe ses marchandises  dans le marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 40 poulets et 50 plaquettes d’œufs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Magadju is a saleswoman and member of the business group «Pendeza». She is a businesswoman aged 24 with three children, two of them go to school and one is still an infant. The client sells chickens and eggs. She sets up her wares at a market in the town. She started her business with a first capital that she received from her husband. Her husband is a teacher in a public school. At a later time she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for two years. This new loan will enable her to buy 40 chickens and 50 packs of eggs. In this way she hopes to increase her capital, become a wholesaler, educate, feed, and clothe her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima warmly for their contribution towards the independence of non-bankable women in business, especially during this critical time of conflict in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: To buy 40 chickens and 50 packs of eggs.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Celeny De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Celeny es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, madre de 4 hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente día a día para darles sustento y educación.
Hace algunos años inició su propio negocio, una cafetería en la que ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, alimentos fritos, gaseosas, entre otros, adicionalmente vende mercancía y productos por catálogo, con el fin de complementar los ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Su actitud positiva y su carisma le han permitido ser reconocida en el sector, esto influye en su negocio, pues aumenta las ventas.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, tennis) e insumos para la cafetería (verduras, granos, pastas, entre otros), esto le permitirá capitalizar sus actividades y podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a su clientela y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades, dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en el nivel de utilidades que obtiene.
Celeny tiene como proyecto para un futuro cercano, hacer crecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le permita generar más ingresos para poder construir su casa en material, pues se encuentra en obra negra; asó logrará ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y disfrutar un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Celeny is a thriving and hardworking woman. The mother of 4 children, she works tirelessly day after day to sustain and educate them. A few years ago Celeny launched her own business, a café offering breakfast, lunch, fried foods and sodas. She also sells merchandise and catalog products, which complement her earnings and help her support her husband with the household expenses. 

Celeny's positive attitude and charisma have made her well-recognized in her area, which influences her businesses by increasing her sales. She would like to invest the loan she had requested into the purchase of merchandise (jeans, shirts and tennis shoes) from wholesalers; and into supplies like vegetables, grains and pasta for the café. This will enable her to capitalize on her activities by offering a greater variety to her customers which will satisfy their wants and needs. The result of this will be an increase in her sales and in her earnings. 

One project Celeny has for the near future is to grow her business so that it is profitable and permits her to increase her earnings to the point where she will be able to build a permanent structure for her home, which is now made out of temporary materials. This will improve her family's quality of life and they will enjoy a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (jeans, shirts, tennis shoes) in bulk, as well as supplies for her café such as vegetables, grains and pasta.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, a sus 61 años de edad, se dedica desde muy joven a realizar trabajos de confección y modistería, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica, su pequeño taller se encuentra ubicado en un espacio de la casa donde reside, allí trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, pues depende de los pedidos que tenga pendientes; de esta forma genera los recursos económicos suficientes para su sustento diario, pues vive sola porque su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una máquina plana y materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, encaje, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y podrá cumplir con los pedidos de manera oportuna pues tendrá el material disponible para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 
Es así como María desea seguir luchando, pues manifiesta que su edad no le impide soñar y por ello trabaja día a día para cumplir su objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo; así tendrá la posibilidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and has worked making dresses and clothing since she was very young. She learned this trade through experience. Her small work space is located at her home. Here, she works everyday without an established schedule because her time is based on the orders that she has pending. In this way she is able to earn enough income to get by everyday. María lives alone as her husband passed away a while ago. 

She is now requesting financing support to buy a tabletop sewing machine and wholesale material including fabric, thread, lace, buttons and other items. This will allow her to improve her working conditions and fulfill the orders on time by having the material available to satisfy her customers' demands. 

María will keep working hard in this way, stating that her age does not keep her from dreaming and for this reason she works everyday to fulfill her goal of expanding her business and generating employment opportunities. In this way she will be able to enjoy a higher standard of living and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and wholesale materials like fabric, thread, lace and buttons.

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en:
The Vida Trust Bank group was established by Field Partner Friendship Bridge, about five years ago, in the second largest city in Guatemala, Quetzaltenango. It is composed of eleven female entrepreneurs, who are engaged in various commercial ventures such as the sale of clothing, cosmetics and perfumes, the manufacture of shoes, and the operation of small shops selling useful items for daily consumption.

Florinda is a 47-year-old member of the Vida Trust Bank group. She is married with five children. Along with her husband, Florinda owns a shoe workshop and has seven employees. Four of the employees are family members and two are employees who live nearby. With the year-end holidays quickly approaching, Florinda anticipates increased business. She is applying for a new loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy material to make shoes. Florinda, along with her husband are pleased to access this vital financial capital so that they can purchase additional supplies. As with almost all of the clients of Friendship Bridge, the greatest hope that Florinda has is to see her children continue with their education and hopefully, graduate from college. She realizes they will enjoy more opportunities with increased education.

All of the women in the Vida Trust Bank group appreciate the confidence of KIVA investors. They say that the loans not only help them but also their families. The women are most pleased to be able to enroll their children in school in the coming year. They also look forward to saving a little as well. Finally, the women of the Vida Trust Bank group want to extend their very best wishes for good health and prosperity to KIVA investors throughout the world.

loans.use: To buy material to make shoes.

loans.name: Osiel

texts.es:
Osiel  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado entonces desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque le fue muy bien con el crédito y pudo incrementar el capital del negocio. 

Osiel continúa dedicándose a la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, yeso, piedra, arena y etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, piedra chancada y yeso. 

Osiel  nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos a quienes saca adelante
texts.en:
Osiel is grateful to lenders for the loan and he is happy for the support that has been given him. He would like to continue participating in this project because his previous loan turned out so well for him and he was able to increase the capital of his business.

Osiel continues to work selling construction materials, such as cement, plaster, stone, sand, etc. He was been working at this business for a number of years now and it does very well for him because of the hard work and effort he puts into his work. He is requesting this loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, crushed stone and plaster.

Osiel was born in the city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco. He lives with his family in this beautiful city. He is 30 years old and is in a common law relationship with two children, for whom he provides.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, crushed stone and plaster.

loans.name: Darío Antonio

texts.es:
Darío, a sus 52 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos a los que sacó adelante con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación. Durante 20 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en la calle, pues es reciclador y todo lo que consigue lo vende para generar sus propios ingresos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de chatarra (equipos de oficina y archivo) para revenderlo y generar mejores utilidades, pues pagan bien por ese tipo de reciclaje, así estará en la capacidad de reinvertir en su negocio y seguir progresando.
El propósito de Darío es darle continuidad a su actividad, pues ha sido su fuente de ingresos durante más de 20 años y le ha permitido obtener su vivienda y sacar adelante a su familia, así tendrá la capacidad para poder disfrutar una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Darío, 52, is the father of four children who he moves forward with much effort and dedication. For 20 years, he has worked on the street. He is a recycler and everything he gets, he sells to earn his own income.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying scrap metal such as office equipment and filing cabinets so he can resell it and make a better profit. Customers pay well for this type of recycling, so he will be able to reinvest in his business and keep improving.

Darío's goal is to keep working in this business since it has been his source of income for over 20 years. This business has allowed him to get a house and move his family forward. It will also provide him with the ability to enjoy old age without worrying about money.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal such as office equipment and filing cabinets.

loans.name: Presily

texts.en:
Presily is a married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari store, a general store selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Presily works hard in order to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. As of now, Presily is asking for a loan to buy more inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soap, shampoo, soda, sugar, cooking ingredients, and others. Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of her products, thus attracting more customers.

In the future, Presily hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs, like food and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soap, shampoo, soda, sugar, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bikwekwe est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires « Karibu », entrepreneur, âgée de 37 ans  et mère de 5 enfants qui 5 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (de pomme de terre et farine de manioc). Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un spécialiste de la cuisine moderne. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pomme de terre et 1 sac de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants.En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’un bébé se met debout à coté d’une cliente.
texts.en:
Bikwekwe is a shopkeeper and member of the "Karibu" business group, an entrepreneur, and is 37 years old and mother of 5 children who are in school and 2 who are still little. She sells food staples (potatoes and cassava flour). She displays her merchandize at home in front of her fence, where she has been able to attract her customers. 

She began her business with the first capital from her husband. He specializes in modern cuisine. Later on, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy a bag of potatoes and a bag of cassava flour. She hopes this will allow her to buy some land and build on it, as well as feed her children and send them to school. 

Finally, she is especially grateful to Hekima for helping empower women who are denied access to traditional banking, especially during this critical time of war in the eastern part of the country. It should be noted that there is a child standing next to one of the group members.

loans.use: to buy a bag of potatoes and a bag of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 43 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice for more than three years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is a police officer who makes an income of USD 4 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rice to resell. This money will help her expand the business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her store to make it bigger and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len is 57 years old. She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is involved in distilling alcohol and breeding pigs. He makes an income of $5 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Len is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to resell. This money will help her add more stock and generate more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her store and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Sokhorl

texts.en: Sokhorl is 43 years old, married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in weaving for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband (joining her in the picture) is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Sokhorl is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her run a new business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run her own weaving business and help her children achieve a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, es acompañado, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, no posee familia en el extranjero, para darle a su familia el sustento diario se dedica a atender su tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, es un negocio que lo emprendió por iniciativa propia desde hace 18 meses, su horario es de 5:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. todos los días es apoyado por su esposa para realizar eta actividad.
Comprara carnes, embutidos, azúcar, lejía, jabón, golosinas, bebidas, con lo que podrá mejorar su inventario para dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan en su hogar, espera mejorar las ventas y aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar el crédito de una manera responsable para luego seguir invirtiendo fácilmente.
Sueña hacer crecer su negocio para que sus hijos puedan tener oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Jose is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 6 and 4.  He doesn’t have any family on foreign lands.  He has a store where he sells primary needs products and started this business on his own 18 months ago.  His hours are from 5:00 am to 7:00 pm.  His wife helps him every day.

He will buy meat, sausages, sugar, bleach, soap, snacks, and drinks so he can better his inventory and provide his customers with what they need.  He hopes to improve his sales, increase his profits, and pay off the debt responsibly so that he can continue investing easily.  He dreams of growing his business so that his children can have the opportunity to attend university.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Depuis 2011, Kodjo a ouvert son cybercafé pour rendre service à ceux qui n'ont pas d'internet à domicile. Dans son cybercafé, il répare aussi des portables. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des ordinateurs et accessoires informatiques. Il souhaite à l'avenir, avoir un grand cyber et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale. Il est âgé de 27ans.
texts.en: Kodjo has opened his Internet café in 2011, providing a service t to those who do not have Internet access at home. In his Internet cafe he also repairs cell phones. In order to develop his business further, he is seeking his first loan to buy computers and computer accessories. In the future he would like to have a large  Internet café and be able to settle down and start a family. He is 27 years old.

loans.use: to buy computers and accessories.

loans.name: Naren

texts.en: Naren is 30 years old, single and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $9 per day. Due to lack of funds, Naren is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en: Chanry is 33 years old, married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a barber shop for more than five years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife is a garment worker who makes an income of $3 each day. Due to lack of funds, Chanry is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase construction materials to fix his house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his shop and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his house

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Hieng is 64 years old, married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband runs a motor taxi service. He makes an income of $3 per day. Three of her children are garment workers who earn about $12 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Hieng is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase acacia trees to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase acacia trees to resell

loans.name: Sumkhuu

texts.en: Sumkhuu, 23 years old, lives with his wife and son in a house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a grocery store since 2012. His wife stays at home, looking after their little son. He has recently bought an electric car and paid only half of the price. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay the remaining part of the price of the car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air because it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. The car will be used by him for a taxi service as his wife will eventually take care of the grocery store after years.

loans.use: to pay the remaining part of the price of the car he just bought

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en: Munkhzul, 41 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling automobile spare parts since 2011. Using his previous loan, he has opened his second automobile shop. His second automobile shop is running well but is always short of cash and working capital, so he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a large quantity of automobile spare parts. As a result, he will be able to continue to run his automobile shop without inventory shortages.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of spare parts

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.en:
Ingrid is a 39-year-old divorced mother of four children and is a member of the Abril Trust Bank group. She is solely responsible for meeting the basic needs of her children. She strives to provide good nutrition for her children, which will hopefully keep them in good health, and works hard to buy clothing for them and to give them the opportunity to attend school. 

Ingrid owns a small shop where she sells items for daily consumption. One month ago, she opened a “tortilleria” where she sells tortillas three times each day. Tortillas are a staple food in Guatemala, made with 100% corn (maize) and essential in the Guatemalan highlands. Ingrid is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase maize in quantity so that she can meet the demands of her customers. In addition, she will purchase items for her store such as beans, pasta, snacks, sodas and purified water. Ingrid had the opportunity to start college and study law but because she needed to put the health and well-being of her children as her highest priority, she decided to put her energy into her two businesses. She understands how important it is for her children to have an education.

This hard-working woman is an example of the ten women in the Abril Trust Bank group. They are requesting loans with Friendship Bridge that they will use in their micro-businesses. Some of these business endeavors include the sale of beauty items, food, cleaning supplies, clothing and tortillas. Others have small shops like Ingrid where they sell essential items for daily consumption.

All of the women in the Abril Trust Bank group send special greetings this holiday season to KIVA investors throughout the world, wishing them peace and harmony. They want to express their appreciation for the loans. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: To purchase maize in quantity to make tortillas for her business.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh is 64 years old lives alone in her apartment in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. She has been running a clothes retail business in the local market for years. She used to sell used bedding and other house decoration items. She is an experienced and hard-working woman who does very good bookkeeping of her business income and expenses. Her children are married and live in Ulaanbaatar city. She helps them to live on their own. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000MNT to purchase large amousnt of clothing inventory to sell for the new year when sales peak.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of clothing inventory

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Mr.Batdelger is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Tsend-Ayush, tailors the national costume and modern clothing by order at home. His older daughter goes to a local kindergarten and his younger twin boys are two years old and stay at home. 

Batdelger has been providing shoe repair and traditional boot and shoe manufacturing by order at home for years. He is an experienced cobbler, well-known among his clients, who is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of leather, soles, and other materials to meet clients' orders on time. He said, "Winter is the high season for my business and my wife's. So we need to work very hard to make more sales."

loans.use: to purchase large amount of leather, soles, and other materials to meet clients' orders on time

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa femme de 35ans, revend des trousseaux bébé à domicile depuis 2009. Manquant de fonds pour augmenter son stock, elle fait un prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle souhaite développer son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 35-year-old woman who has been selling baby accessories from her home since 2009. She does not have the funds to increase her stock, so she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandize. She hopes to expand her business and provide for the well-being of her family. She is married with children.

loans.use: to buy baby accessories.

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es: Socorro es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de un hijo independiente. Tiene 41 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace 16 años, con pocos productos. Luego con las ganancias de las ventas, fue comprando más producto y seguir ofreciendo. Poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio, y actualmente cuenta con un negocio estable y visitado por sus clientes. Su meta próxima es ofrecer cada vez más los productos que demandan los clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, pan, aceite entre otros, con el fin de brindar una mayor cantidad de productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y de su negocio.
texts.en:
Socorro is originally from the city of Estelí.  She is married and the mother of one child who is independent.  Socorro is 41 years old.  She is a merchant who manages a grocery business that she started 16 years ago with few products.  With the profits from her sales, she was able to buy more products that she could continue offering.  Little by little she was able to grow her business.  Now she has a stable business that is frequented by her customers.  Her next goal is to offer more products each time that her customers demand them.  

Socorro is requesting a loan so that she can buy rice, sugar, sodas, bread, oil, and other products.  This will allow her to have a larger quantity of products.  She expects the loan will be of great help since she will be able to increase her sales and generate better profits.  Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of both her home and her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, sodas, bread, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a resident of the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through her pig raising business. Nelia has been raising pigs for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Nelia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Nelia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for her business

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife takes care of their livestock. They have moved to Tosontsengel soum center to get their son to attend a local kindergarten. His daughter is two and stays home.

Ganbat and his wife used to herd their livestock and live in the countryside. Now, as they have moved to a residential area, Ganbat is starting a business with one partner as a wood furniture manufacturer. Ganbat used to help his father to craft wood furniture and ger parts as a kid. He is a talented, diligent and hardworking man who is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start his business

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is aged 54. She patiently roams around their village to sell daily cooked foods. Celestina wakes up early in the morning to buy meats, vegetables, and raw materials in the market. At home, Celestina starts to cook different dishes to sell for lunch. According to her, her income every day is sufficient but still she wants to save some of it for their future emergencies. That's why she also has a retail store to generate additional profits. 

With this, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase raw meat, vegetables, and food seasonings to use in her food vending business. She will assure that her business will continue to grow to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, vegetables, and food seasonings to use in her food vending business

loans.name: Dc2 - Yen Truong Group

texts.en: Tuyen, 35, is working at Breeding Center with an average monthly income of VND 6,500,000. She lives with her husband who is a farmer, along with her two children. Her family's earnings mainly come from farming, including cultivating rice and cereal. Currently, she's having a challenge of crop damage from the last harvest. Both of her children are still in school and she wants to expand her business to cover their tuition fees as well as let them to reach a better standard of living. For that reason, she wants to make a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her yield and increase her family's income. She hopes that her family would be healthier, happier, and more abundant in life. Tuyen is the team leader of DC2 - Yen Truong Group, which has four members. In the picture, she stands at the second from the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice and cereal field

loans.name: Chakriya

texts.en:
Chakriya is 46 years old.  She is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She is a metal sculptor who earns a daily income of $3.  Two of her children are employed.  One is a sales representative and the other is an arc welder.  They earn a combined daily income of $10.  

To improve her son’s business, Chakriya is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase metal for her son to use in his business.  By doing so, he would be able to produce more roofs, windows and doors to sell and earn more income for the family.  

In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase metal for her son to use in his business

loans.name: Violet Group

texts.en:
Rosela is the featured borrower of Violet group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to be able to share the Holy Christmas spirit with their beloved families back in the Philippines.

Rosela is a 47-year-old widowed mother of three children. She works hard as a housekeeper to provide her children with the necessary standard of living. Rosela is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to send money to her beloved children for whom she takes on the role of both the responsible father who passed away and the beloved and caring mother to make sure that they will have a delightful Christmas Celebration with her parents in the Philippines.

Rosela is the first lady from the right. The other group members are Lucia Delasa, the first from the left, Nida, the second from the left, and Violeta, the second from the right.

loans.use: to send money to her children for Christmas

loans.name: Sobhiya

texts.en:
Sobhiya is a  54-year-old mother of four precious children. She has been working with her husband in running their own ice cream and juice selling business for seventeen years.

Sobhiya is a hard worker who puts much effort into developing her family's socioeconomic situation. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special ice cream raw materials that she will get at very competitive prices during this season which will increase her income automatically.

She has future plans.  Sobhiya plans to buy more freezers and will increase her production to start up an ice cream wholesale trade in nearby villages, It will take a lot of time to start this plan, but Sobhiya is determined to start it.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying seasonal raw materials for special ice cream

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en:
Mr. Adiya is 34 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.  The family resides in old house on a plot of land.  He has been working as an operator at a steel factory since 2010.  His wife sells clothes by renting a stall at the trade center. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair.  So, he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT in order to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and cotton to renovate his house.  After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and, as a result, fewer pollutants will be released into air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Sabina Paulina

texts.es:
Sabina continua con la venta golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, chicles y tortas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo dulces y galletas para incrementar el capital del negocio. 

Sabina vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Sabina operates a business buying and selling soft drinks, cookies and other snacks.  She has made her living from the business for many years and it's a success because she's worked to make it a success.  Sabina is a member of the Mamacha Carmen community bank and she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise that she will resell for a profit.

Sabina, 44, and her family live in Paucartambo, a pretty town in the "departamento" of Cusco.  She and her wonderful husband are committed to helping their three children get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Maranatha De Samarie 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Rosena est le coordinatrice de son groupe Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3. Elle est marié, ell a 2  enfants. Rosena habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Elle dirige son commerce d' articles divers  pendants les 12 dernières années

Elle  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres  Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3 ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que: ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc.  Elle déclare que son défi principal est de venir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord.

Elle dit son but principal c'est d'avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  à construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Rosena is the coordinator of her group, Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3. She is married and has 2 children. Rosena lives in the northeastern part of Haiti where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. 

She has been in business selling sundries for the last 12 years. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business. 

Other members of the Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 3 group need a loan for their businesses selling things such as food items, carbonated beverages, shoes, clothing, etc.
