She states that her most important challenge is to become a major retailer in the northern region. She says her main goal is to have a large business that will make it possible for her to build a large house with the aid from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy sundries, like cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина  молодая бабушка. У неё недавно родилась внучка и принесла в её жизнь радости и света. Зарина очень рада появлению внучки, но её беспокоят мысли об провидение мероприятия в честь её внучки. Ведь год назад она сыграла свадьбу дочки и потратила все свои заначки. И  на данный момент не имеет достаточно средств. Она швея и хорошая хозяйка. У неё двадцатилетний стаж работы. Её ежемесячный доход хватает на ежедневное  пропитание. Муж по необходимости уехал в трудовую миграцию. Часть присылаемых денег мужа Зарина тратит на обучение детей, а часть оставляет на «чёрный день». Несмотря на тяжелое положение, и финансовые затруднение, она рада, что будет тратить накопленные деньги не на «чёрный день», а в честь рождения внучки – на проведения мероприятия. Но накопленных денег не много и  хватят только на половину реализации планированного. Для воплощения своих мыслей и целей в реальность Зарине пришлось обратиться за кредитом. Она решила воспользоваться кредитными услугами МДО «Арванд». На полученный кредит Зарина хочет купить подарки для внучки и дочери.Очень надеется на помощь и поддержку  со стороны «Арванд" и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en:
Zarina is a young grandmother. Her grand daughter's recent birth brought joy and light into her life. Zarina is very happy about having a grandchild, but the thought of hosting an event in honor of the child worries her. Just last year she threw the wedding party for her daughter, and used up her savings, so now she just doesn't have the money. 

Zarina is a seamstress and good housewife. She has a 12 year work record, and her income is enough for everyday food expenses. Her husband had to leave to be a migrant worker. Zarina spends part of the money he sends back on the children's education, and she keep some for a raining day. 

Despite the difficult position and financial hardships, she is glad to spend the money saved not on a rainy day, but on an party in honor of her grand daughter's birth. However, the saved money isn't much, and is only enough to pay for half of the plans. Zarina is asking for a loan to carry out her plans and goals. She decided to seek a loan from MDO Arvand. She wants to use the loan to buy presents for her grand daughter and daughter. She hopes for your help and support from Arvand, and thanks you for the assistance.

loans.use: to buy gifts

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es reconocida por su carisma y empuje, dedicada a su familia conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
En su vida productiva se ha dedicado al comercio independiente, inició ofreciendo productos pequeños como medias, moños y encargos que le hacías, pero luego decidió adaptar un espacio de su vivienda para atender a su clientela y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta convertir su negocio en una miscelánea con 6 años de trayectoria en el sector, en la que ofrece diversos artículos como juguetes, accesorios, productos de papelería, entre otros.
Con el propósito de fortalecer cada vez más su negocio, desea invertir el crédito en la compra de surtido al por mayor (accesorios, productos de aseo personal, juguetería, artículos de papelería, cosméticos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y mejorar notablemente las ventas; además, con las ganancias que obtiene podrá reinvertir en el negocio, pues su sueño es darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo, así Luz estará en la capacidad de brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is known for her charisma and her drive, and is dedicated to her family, which consists of her husband and their two children. She has made an enormous effort to provide her children with a good education.

She has always spent her working life in independent commerce. She started by selling small things such as stockings, hair decorations and orders that she received. Then she decided to adapt a space in her home for her customers. Slowly her business grew, until 6 years later it was offering a range of products such as toys, accessories and stationery items.

Luz would like to strengthen her business even more by investing the loan to buy stock wholesale, including products such as accessories, personal care items, toys, stationery and cosmetics. This will allow her to offer more variety to satisfy her customers' wants and to make a significant improvement in her sales. In addition, with the profits she makes she will be able to re-invest in the business, since her dream is to provide it with continuity and permanence over time. In this way, Luz will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock such as accessories, personal care items, toys, stationery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Levita

texts.en: Levita is from the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo. She is married with three school-aged children. Levita manages her fruit and vegetables business. According to her, she offers her products to Urdaneta Pangasinan twice a week. At this moment, Levita needs additional capital due to many orders to her. In this situation, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase more bananas, pineapples, and pomelos to sell. Levita hopes that she could get the amount she requested to further develop her business. In this way, she could secure her family picture and educate her three children.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, pineapples, and pomelos to sell

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Due to financial constraints, Jhona operates her motorcycle transport business to supplement her husband's income. She aims to earn and save more income in order to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. To continue to use her motorcycle, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy gasoline, sprockets and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Through her hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will become more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, sprockets and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has no children. Alae lives with his family composed of 5 members, 3 of whom are employed.

Alae owns a small shop where he makes all types of local and Eastern pastries. He has excellent experience in this field. Alae established his business in 2007. He now has 2 hired employees and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Alae is requesting a youth loan of USD 2,400 in order to install a ceiling for his workplace. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he would be able to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: install a ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is 44 years old and married with two children. She assists her husband in earning her family's income. Since 2009, Huda has operated a small grocery store where she sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. She has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. Huda has an excellent reputation. Huda is requesting a $2,400 USD loan to buy a refrigerator and to increase her inventory of goods to sell. In the future, she plans to increase her business and her profits to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to increase her inventory of goods to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, bread, etc.

Elsie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of retail items.

In the future Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Edras Isai

texts.es:
Edras, es casado, vive junto a su esposa, se dedica a vender ropa nueva, es un oficio que aprendió desde pequeño, se lo enseño su padre, hoy lo hace de forma independiente en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., según estén las ventas, no se le hace difícil manejar este negocio.
Invertirá  en la compra de faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc., con lo que el inventario de su negocio estará surtido para estas épocas navideñas que se acercan, espera tener un aumento en sus ventas, obtener ingresos extras con los que su economía mejorara y cancelara sus deudas.
Edras sueña con tener el suficiente capital para comprar su casa propia y seguir dándole lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Edras is married and lives with his wife.  He makes a living selling new clothing, a trade he learned from a young age from his father.  Edras now works autonomously from 8am until 5pm, depending on sales.  It is not difficult for him to run this business.

Edras will invest this loan in buying skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts, and more so that his business is stocked up for the ever-nearing Christmas season.  Edras hopes to see an increase in his sales and to earn a little extra income in order for his financial situation to improve and so he can pay of his debts.

Edras dreams of having enough capital to buy his own house and to continue giving his family the best he can.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and more.

loans.name: Luz Faride

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 46 años de edad, víctima del desplazamiento forzado debido a la violencia que se presentaba en su pueblo natal; se trasladó con su esposo para la ciudad donde comenzó a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo alimentos fritos en diferentes cafeterías, a las afueras de instituciones educativas y de manera ambulante por las diferentes calles del centro de la ciudad; esta actividad surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sustento familiar. 
Actualmente, se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un local arrendado, dotado con estanterías y vitrinas, razón que la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, pues requiere comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato,  granos, azúcar, sal, panela, café, chocolate, lácteos, carnes frías, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), pagar el arriendo del local y de los equipos que posee; con esto podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo, con el que espera lograr una mejor rentabilidad, para posicionarse en el sector. 
Luz desea ir fortaleciendo poco a poco su negocio y, en un futuro anhela poder ser propietaria tanto del local como de los activos, para garantizar una entrada de dinero estable que le permita aportar a la economía de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida y bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 46 years old and, because of the violence in her town of birth, has become a victim of forced displacement.  Luz came to the city with her husband and it is here that she started to work as an independent businesswoman, selling fried foods in different cafés, outside schools, and as a street vendor in the city centre.  Luz started this work as she needed an income to support her family.

Luz has been presented with the opportunity to start renting a property equipped with display cases and shelves.  As a reuslt she has decided to apply for a loan because she needs to buy stock in bulk (cakes, grains, sugar, salt, coffee, hot chocolate, diary products, cold meats and other basic goods) and to pay the rent for the property and furnishings.  With this loan, Luz can start a new, productive project, with which she hopes to have a more profitable business that she can establish in the area.

Luz wants to strengthen her business little by little and, in the future, she would very much like to own both the premises and the furnishings she will rent.  This will guarantee her a steady income, allowing her bring money home to the family kitty and to improve her family's well-being and quality of living.

loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (cakes, grains, sugar, salt, coffee, hot chocolate, diary products, cold meats and other basic goods) and to pay the rent for the property and furnishings.

loans.name: Xiomara Marily

texts.es:
Xiomara, es una joven que vive con sus padres y una hermana, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar en los gastos familiares hace cinco años instalo una pupusería en su casa de habitación la atiende de 4:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m., es una actividad que prendió de su mamá, su ventaja es que el negocio está ubicado en las cercanías de una cancha muy frecuentada por los habitantes de localidad.
Invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, bebidas, verduras y gas propano, contando con los insumos necesarios podrá continuar trabajando y dando un buen servicio, espera atender mejor a sus clientes, ampliar poco a poco su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias.
Sueña con seguir apoyando a sus padres económicamente y darles una mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a young woman who still lives with her parents and one of her sisters.  Xiomara is 25 years old, single, and, because she needed to earn an income to help with family costs, five years ago she started a business selling "pupusas" (cheese tortillas stuffed with pork, corn and other items).  Working from 4am until 9pm, Xiomara learned this trade from her mother.  One strength for her business is that it is located near to a sports field used by the town's inhabitants.

Xiomara will invest this loan in buying cheese-stuffed tortillas, pork, corn, drinks, vegetables and propane gas.  This will give her the necessary supplies to continue working and providing a good service.  Xiomara hopes to offer her customers better service, to expand her business little by little and to increase her sales and her profits.

Xiomara dreams of being able to continue supporting her parents financially and of providing them with better food, health and clothing.

loans.use: to buy cheese-stuffed tortillas, pork, corn, drinks, vegetables and propane gas.

loans.name: Nandita

texts.en:
Nandita is 46 years old. She lives in the small village of South Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She received education up to Class IX (Grade 9). She is married and has three young children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband Bikash is 50 years old. He passed Class V (Grade 5) only. Their only daughter is married. Nandita's husband and sons work in a teashop. Her husband's income is very low to meet all the family expenses. when the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, it is impossible for them to meet the needs of their family.

Nandita is very hard working. She decided to purchase a cow and start milk supply business in her locality to give financial support to her family. She is taking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS,to purchase a cow. 

In the future she also hopes to set aside the extra profit to buy more cows to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start milk supply business

loans.name: Subharani

texts.en:
Subharani is a 41-year-old housewife and a mother of four children (three sons and one daughter), two of whom are in different grades in elementary school. Her husband Nimai is 48 years old.  Both Subharani and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  They live in their pacca house (concrete made) in the small village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Two of their children are receiving an education. They are in class X (Grade 10) and class VII (Grade 7). The other two are below the school-going age.
Subharani's husband is engaged in the business of selling milk in the market. He buys milk from the dairy farms and supplies in the neighboring villages and door to door in their locality. In this way, he earns money to maintain the livelihood of their family. Since there is a huge demand for milk and dairy products in the local market, She decided to buy a cow to start a business of selling milk and dairy products in the locality

She came to know about Kiva's partner, BJS, that BJS gives loans to rural women to start business of their own. So, she applied for the loan with which she will buy a cow and start a dairy products business, producing items such as milk, butter, paneer, curd etc.   She wants to sell them in the local market. There is a great demand of these products in the local market. This will help her generate more income for her family and household. She wants to help their children with their educations, so that they will be able to reach their goals and fulfill their dreams.

She is grateful to BJS as well as to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a business of selling milk and dairy products in the locality..

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en: Maisa was born in 1989. She is single and has 7 siblings living at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Maisa has been selling blankets for 1 year. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her family in improving their living conditions. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Al-Samah Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Samah. It consists of three members who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 210,000 YER. Lwaheth is 39 years old. She is married and has children. She has been selling clothes, incense and perfumes for many years. She is experienced in her business. She started her business with a small amount of capital. She received money from a ladies' association, which enabled her to expand her business to sell clothes, incense and perfumes. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from to buy extra clothes, incense and perfumes for her business. She hopes to expand her business and get more profit.

loans.use: to buy extra clothes, incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Khawer

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Khawer, 40 years old, and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for several years and it's working very well. He is the father of a son who mostly remains sick. He checked him up at the specialist, but now his disease is still constant. He does not have more kids, so that he wants to see his son healed and healthy. 

For this purpose, he has been spending a lot of money. Khawer has to generate maximum profits from his current enterprise so that he can easily provide medical treatments to his son. He wants to increase the stock in the general store so that he can get maximum profit.

Therefore, Khawer requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.
Khawer is very glad after taking this loan, and hopeful that he will succeed in getting the maximum income this time so he can provide better medical facility to his son. 

Khawer is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is a 26-year-old woman. She is married and a housewife. Sahara is a mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. They live in the small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (a house made of mud, straw and bamboo). Sahara finished primary education, whereas her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. All their children are receiving education, and in class VI (grade 6), class II (grade 2) and class I (grade 1) respectively.

Sahara's husband is a farmer by profession. He is the main source of income for the family. With the small means, they somehow manage the needs of the family. But it has become difficult for them to overcome the financial hurdles, as the prices of daily necessities are going up day by day. They have decided to start cultivation of potatoes, but this needs capital, which they don’t have.

Sahara asked for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. She wants to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes and sell them in the market. She is hopeful about the business, as it is a lucrative one due to high demand for potatoes in their area.

She dreams to give a good quality of education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business, and at the same time, a decent lifestyle to their family with the profits that she will earn from her business.

She gives hearty thanks to BJS and to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold is 25 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family resides in a brick house on a fenced piece of land.  He has been working at a hotel since 2010.  His wife stays at home, looking after their son. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT in order to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house.  After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo
Saeda is 53 years old and married, from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a small humble house. 

For the past three years, Saeda's husband has been working in a small grocery shop he owns.  It is a good business, and his shop is located in a very good area in the city. 

Saeda and her husband would like to develop their store  but they don't have enough money for it. Saeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to expand their grocery shop and add more shelves. 

By taking this loan, the store will be in a better condition, and its productivity will increase.

loans.use: to expand her grocery shop and add more shelves

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong was born in a well-educated family. Not only her mother but also her father has a bachelor's degree. Currently, Huong is studying at Hanoi Pedagogical University No2 (http://www.hpu2.edu.vn/). During her study, she also works as a personal tutor for pupils. However it is not enough to support her study. 

Standing next to Huong in this picture is her mother. Since her mother has retired, the main income of Huong's family comes from the salary of her father, who is a veterinarian. Usually, her father earns 8,000,000 VND per month which is not enough to provide for Huong and her siblings’ education. 

Thus, Huong asks to borrow an amount of 10,710,000 VND to finance her study. She expects that after she graduates, she will be able to find a stable job and share the economic burden for her father.  Thanks for the program, she can continue her study. She would love to see more students have the chance to fulfill their dreams like her.

loans.use: to finance her study.

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: Larry es un hombre trabajador, junto a su esposa luchan para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, dos de ellos en edades escolares y un bebe, Larry labora para el ministerio de salud como conductor y su esposa de conserje, de esta manera ambos se ayudan para sacar adelante a su familia. Se poya con este crédito solicitado para cambiar el techo de su vivienda el cual está muy deteriorada, siendo una casa de muchos años ya requiere de mantenimientos, gracias al financiamiento podrá comprar laminas de zinc, perlines y el pago de la mano de obra, con esta inversión garantizara la seguridad y tranquilidad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Larry is a hard-working man and, alongside his wife, he is fighting to help his three children get ahead.  Two of the children are of school age while the youngest is still a baby.  Larry works as a driver for the department of health while his wife is a janitor.  Larry is applying for this loan in order to replace the much deteriorated roof of his home.  The house is quite old and so requires maintenance work. Thanks to this loan, Larry will be able to buy zinc sheeting and purlins and can pay labourers.  This investment will allow Larry to give his children a safe and peaceful home.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and purlins and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Mr.Batmunh is 31 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in a small house in Zavhan province, Mongolia.  His wife, Altantsetseg, is a teacher at a local school.  His son is five years old and attends the local kindergarten. 

Since 2009, Batmunh has been running a business, selling animal pelts and other livestock parts, which are used as the raw material for a lot of things.  He has purchased a small truck for his business use.  He is now planning to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other intestines to sell to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar.  He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to facilitate this purchase and increase both his inventory and his sales income. 

He is a hardworking, diligent and helpful man.

loans.use: to purchase a large inventory of animal pelts and intestines.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y continua con la venta frutas y granos secos entonces ella lleva los granos sacos al valle de Kosñipata después distribuye a diferentes revendedoras y luego ella regresa a Paucartambo trayendo frutas como por ejemplo piña, naranjas, plátanos, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas para incrementar el capital del negocio.
 
Maximiliana vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Maximiliana wants you to know that she is grateful for your support.  She has long operated a business buying and selling fruits and grains.  She buys supplies of grains in the Kosñipata valley and sells what she buys to resellers.  She then returns to Paucartambo with fruit--pineapples, oranges, platanos, etc.--that she sells in the town.  She has had the business for many years and it's successful because of her strong commitment to it.  Maximiliana belongs to the Mamacha Carmen community bank and she will use this loan to stock her fruit-sales business.

Maximiliana and her family live in Paucartambo, a pretty town in the "departamento" of Cusco.  She and her wonderful husband work hard to ensure that their five children can get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her fruit-sales business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a brindar servicios de llamadas, ella sale muy temprano de su casa se instala en una esquina de la calle o sea de forma ambulatoria entonces las personas utilizan sus celulares para realizar llamadas a otros celulares o teléfonos fijos entonces ella cobra el minuto de llamada a cincuenta centavos de nuevo sol. (S/. 0.50). Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para recargar con minutos los celulares para que las personas realicen las llamadas. 

Victoria vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Victoria is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan and is happy for the support provided.  She continues to provide call services and leaves her home very early each morning, sets up on a corner, in other words on foot, and people use her cell phones to call other cell phones or land lines, then she charges one half of a Nuevo Sol (S/. 0.50) per minute.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts in.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and needs a loan to recharge the minutes on her call phone so that people can make calls.

Victoria lives with her family in the lovely city of Paucartambo, within the Cusco department.  She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children.

loans.use: to recharge her cell phones.

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka, age 44, is married to Kabi Kanta and has three children. She is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. They both are illiterate, but able to sign their name only. Two of the children are studying in class IX and VIII (grade 9 and grade 8). Their other child works as a mason. They live in Madhya Boragadi at Dhupgudi.

The earning from their work was too low to run a family. Renuka heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) offers loans to women in the community. So, she applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes on her own plot of agricultural land. She has given preference to this, as it is a lucrative and profitable business in the local area, and there is a great demand in the worldwide market. 

Her dream is to give a better future to her children so that they do not have to suffer financially in the future.

She stays in a kachha house (house made of straw, mud, bamboo. etc.), but dreams of a concrete house in the future. So, she hopes that the loan will solve her poverty, including her agricultural benefits. She will be highly obliged to BJS and Kiva by taking the loan for her new future plan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 45 years old.  She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  She and her family happily live at Centro 2 in San Guillermo.

Milagros generates income through her sari-sari or general store.  She has been running this business for one year and is able to earn a net income of about 300 PHP a day.  Her income goes toward their daily necessities and other household expenses.

Milagros would like to take out a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP in order to purchase grocery items such as snack foods, condiments, beverages, shampoo, eggs and biscuits to sell.  She hopes that she will improve her business as well as her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as snack foods, condiments, beverages, shampoo, eggs and biscuits.

loans.name: Mayra Cristela

texts.es:
Mayra de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta la educación media, gracias a la ayuda de sus padres, desgraciadamente, ya no pudieron continuar ayudando para que siguiera sus estudios. Esta soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y sus hermanas.

Mayra desde que termino sus estudios de educación media el año anterior, logro conseguir un empleo el cual es cuidar a un bebe de 3 años. Ademas, desde hace seis meses, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, actividad que conoce, ya que su hermana también trabajo en un tiempo en esta misma actividad y Mayra aprendió las técnicas que se utilizan para el cuidado y mantenimiento de los pollos. 

El préstamo sera utilizado, para ampliar y mejorar la galera donde se mantienen los pollos, ya que desea ingresar un mayor numero de pollos y la galera con la que cuenta, no soporta un numero mayor. De esta forma se esta ayudando a que Mayra continué ampliando su negocio.


Su sueño, es crecer en el negocio de la avicultura, ya que de esta forma tendrá mas opciones de cumplir una de sus metas mas grandes, la cual es continuar estudiando una carrera universitaria, la cual podría abrirle las puertas a que su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejore en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mayra is 20 years old and has a middle school education, thanks to her parents’ help.  Unfortunately they were not able to continue supporting her with her education.  She is single, has no children, and lives with her parents and sisters.

Mayra was able to find a job caring for a three year old baby when she finished school a year ago.  She has also had a small chicken farm for the past six months.  She knows this business because her sister also worked it for a time and Mayra learned to care and maintain the chickens.

She will use the money from this loan to expand and improve her chicken farm since she wants to bring in a large number of chickens and her current chicken house will not support a larger number.  In this way Mayra is being supported so she can expand her business.

Her dream is to grow her avian culture business and this way have more options to meet her greater goals which include attending university which will open quality of life doors for her family and provide a better future.

loans.use: to expand her chicken farm.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
Because the prices of feed are high, the Pudak Sari Wangi group goes on, with the same amount as before. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, all members are able to attend the meeting. Each member gets 1.5 Million IDR. The loan will be used to buy superior quality piglets and feed.

Ni Luh will use her part of the loan to buy three superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixed feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. Once she has enough savings for venture capital, then she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru:
Саноат  хрупкая, маленькая женщина с сильной силой духа и со стойкостью как у мужчин. После болезни мужа нашла в себе силы – не сдалась и поствила своих детей на ноги. Ей было очень тяжело поначалу, так как Саноат не находила работу из-за отсутствия диплома о высшем образовании. Но собрав все силы в кулак, решила заняться мелким предпринимательством. Начала продавать хозяйственные товары. Параллельно работала в школе техничкой. Уже повзрослевшие дети также помогают маме и друг другу. Чтобы помочь сыну с работой Саноат решила купить ему автомашину.
 Её сын планирует утром и вечером работать на «службе по доставке колбасных изделий» а днём предлагать услуги таксиста. С этими целями Саноат обратилась а МДО «Арванд» за помощью. Очень надеется и верит на поддержку со стороны организации и «Арванд».
texts.en: Sanoat is a small frail woman with a strong spirit and the firmness of a man. After her husband's illness she discovered her strength, didn't give in, and set her children on their feet. It was very hard for her at first, since she couldn't find work because she lacks a college education. But she gathered her strength and decided to be a small scale entrepreneur. First she became a seller of household items. Then she started working at the same time as a janitor in a school. Her grown children also help their mother and each other. To help her son with his work, Sanoat decided to buy him a car. Her son plans to work mornings and evenings as a transport driver of sausage products, and during the day as a taxi driver. Sanoat came to MDO Arvand for help with this goal. She very much hopes for and trusts the support she receives through Arvand.

loans.use: to buy car

loans.name: Janarkul

texts.ru: Жанаркул 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 дочерей. Обе девочки-школьницы. Супруг работает заведующим клуба, имеет постоянный доход в виде зарплаты. У Жанаркул - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Жанаркул знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Жанаркул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жанаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади, 2 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 10 овец, 9 коз. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец с марта по октябрь месяцы ежегодно выгоняет на пастбища чабану. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жанаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение старшей дочери в высшем учебном заведении, так как, дочь в этом году заканчивает школу и собирается поступать в университет.
texts.en: Janarkul is 49 years old, married, and has two daughters with her spouse. Her husband is a club manager and has a steady income from his salary. Janarkul has a high school education. She takes an optimistic view on life, knowing exactly what she wants and using all her abilities to get there. Janarkul knows how to use and manage money to reach a goal. Janarkul practices animal husbandry to earn the primary income for her family. She started 20 years ago with the purchase of 5,000 som KGS worth of animals. Thanks to her tireless work she now has two horses, two dairy cows, three calves, 10 sheep, and nine goats. She has everything needed to keep animals: a barn to keep them in and pasture. The diary cows are always kept near the house and the family looks after them themselves. The sheep are taken to pasture from March to October by a shepherd. Hay and feed for the animals are readied in sufficient amounts. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop the business Janarkul asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a horse to increase her livestock herd. She plans to use income from use of the loan to invest in further increasing her number of livestock, and she also plans to save some for her oldest daughter to attend college to study education, since the daughter is finishing high school this year and plans to go to college.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Daysy Ely

texts.es: Daysy estudia la carrera de Obstetricia en un Instituto Superior. Daysy tiene 25 años, en la actualidad continua con sus estudios satisfactoriamente. En un futuro quiere especializarse en el área de gineco obstetra para lograrlo desea estudiar y seguir cursos extras sobre ese tema de esa manera lograr ser una excelente profesional. Con el préstamo  solicitado podrá inscribirse en un seminario muy importante para sus estudios.Daysy se siente muy feliz porque gracias a este préstamo puede seguir con sus estudios.Su mayor deseo es ser el orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Daysy is studying obstetrics in a college.  Daysy is 25 years old, and is now continuing successfully with her studies.  In the future, she wants to specialize in the area of OB/GYN.  To do this, she wants to study and continue with extra classes in this area.  In this way, she will become an excellent professional.  

With the loan that she is requesting, she will enroll in a seminar that is very important for her studies.  Daysy feels very happy, because thanks to this loan, she will be able to continue with her education.  Daysy's main desire is to make her parents proud.

loans.use: to enroll in a seminar

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris, es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en casa propia, para apoyar a su familia en los gastos de su familia desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender ganchos, diademas, binchas, colas, etc., de forma ambulante en las calles de su ciudad.
Invertirá en la compra de prendedores, ganchos, colas, diademas, etc., con lo que podrá contar con una variedad de productos que ofrecerá en sus recorridos, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá ir cancelando sus cuotas.
Anhela apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Damaris, 40, is a single mother with two children.  She lives with her children in a house that she owns.  Damaris, a street vendor, started the business 10 years ago and supports her family with the income she makes from it.  She sells jewelry, hairbands and other small personal items that readily catch the eyes of passers-by.  
Damaris will use this loan to restock her business.  The investment will help her to increase her sales and generate the income she needs to both repay the loan and ensure that her children can continue in school.

loans.use: to stock her personal products sales business.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta, opta por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de pescado, camarones, conchas, moluscos, con lo que su negocio ofrecerá variedad de mariscos frescos al público, ofrecerá un buen servicio y continuara ampliando su negocio.
Con la inversión anterior surtir la venta de mariscos, aumento sus ventas, cuenta con clientes más satisfechos, su economía ha mejorado y sigue luchando por sacar adelante a su familia,
texts.en:
Marta is asking for a loan to buy fish, shrimp, clams, and mussels so she can offer a variety of fresh seafood to the public.  She will provide good service and continue to expand her business. 

She previously invested in stocking her seafood business, increased her sales, and has more satisfied customers.  Her finances have improved and she continues working to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Lkagvasuren

texts.en: Mr. Lkagvasuren, 43 years old, lives alone in his house, on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for a living, since 2006. He helps his vulnerable sister in her everyday life, such as by providing food and taking care of her son. His sister's son is currently studying at university and didn't pay his tuition fee. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT, with which to pay university tuition. As a result, his sister's son will be able to continue to study at university without worry. For the borrower, it is the biggest help he can offer for his sister's son.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his sister's son

loans.name: José Heriberto

texts.es:
José es un hombre pujante y trabajador, que siempre ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia; labora arduas jornadas en su propio negocio, una panadería ubicada en una calle principal del barrio donde vive, por lo que es reconocida en el sector, además de ofrecer los productos de panadería, también vende abarrotes de la canasta familiar, así genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Con el propósito de ampliar su negocio para tener mayor rentabilidad, José manifiesta que seguirá trabajando con mucha disciplina y empeño, así logrará sus objetivos; además cuenta con el apoyo del crédito para capitalizar el negocio y comprar insumos y surtido al por mayor (harina, sal, margarina, polvo de hornear, levadura, huevos, lácteos, entre otros), así podrá tener variedad suficiente para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de los compradores que visitan el establecimiento; obteniendo como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en la entrada de recursos económicos con los que seguirá velando por el bienestar de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
José is a vigorous and hard-working man who has always fought to get his family ahead. He works long days in his business, a bakery located on the main street of the neighborhood in which he lives. His business is well-known in the area and besides offering bakery goods he also sells basic food items. This generates enough income for him to cover the basic household expenses. 

With the objective of expanding his business to increase it's profitability, Jose assures us that he will continue to work with much discipline and effort and thus achieve his objectives. Plus he can count on the loan to capitalize his business and buy supplies and stock wholesale (flour, salt. margarine, baking powder, yeast, eggs, dairy products. etc.). So he will be able to satisfy the needs and various tastes of the buyers who visit his shop. As a result his sales will increase and the revenue which he needs to continue caring for the well-being of his family will be coming in.

loans.use: to buy supplies and stock wholesale (flour, salt. margarine, baking powder, yeast, eggs, dairy products. etc.)

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa con 66 años de edad sigue haciéndole frente a la vida, trabajando de manera independiente con la venta de mercancía, actividad que inició hace dos meses con el fin de participar más en el aporte a la economía de su hogar y sentirse útil, pues la carga recayó sobre sus dos hijos luego del fallecimiento de su esposo hace algunos años. Sus principales clientes son amigos y vecinos del sector y trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (ropa y accesorios), esto le permitirá tener más variedad para ofrecer y así satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de su clientela, obteniendo como resultado el incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que percibe.
Rosa manifiesta que a pesar de su avanzada edad, no deja de soñar y quiere seguir trabajando arduamente para lograr montar su propio almacén en el que pueda ofrecer la mercancía y tener la capacidad para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
66-year-old Rosa continues to tackle life, working independently as a seller of merchandise. She began doing this work two months ago with the goal of participating more in bringing in money for her household and to feel useful since the financial burden rested on her two children after her husband passed away several years ago. Her main customers are friends and neighbours, and she works every day from 7am until 8pm. 

She is requesting the support of the loan in order to purchase stock wholesale (clothes and accessories). This will allow her to have a greater variety of products to offer, thereby satisfying the tastes and requirements of her clientele and obtaining an increase in sales and earnings.

Rosa shows that despite her advanced age, she has not stopped dreaming and she wants to continue working hard so she can set up her own store, in which she would offer merchandise, and be able to enjoy a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock wholesale (clothes and accessories)
